original: nas brtsams nas sngar brjod pa'i bris sku'i cho ga bya ste mthar zla ba nya ba la dri dang / bdug pa dang / gtor ma dang / me tog rnams phul nas thun gsum du stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //

translated: At the end, on the full moon, one should offer perfumes, incense, and a bali of flowers, and recite the mantra eight thousand times in three shifts.

original: mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas te 'o ma can gyi ya ma shing gis me sbar nas autpal sngon po la zho dang; sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //

translated: For three nights one should fast and, using sticks of the bodhi tree, light a fire and offer into it eight thousand blue lotus flowers smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: de nas nam mkha' la grub bo //
analyzed: de nas nam mkha' la grub bo //

translated: Beginning on the first day of the bright fortnight, for three nights one should observe chastity and celibacy and offer one thousand and eight oblations of yūthikā and karnikara flowers smeared with milk, curd, and ghee in front of an aśvattha tree.

original: dngul brgya rnyed pa'am /

original: mtshan phyed nas chu klung du phyin nas dri zhim po'i me tog gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya ste dong tse lnga brgya rnyed pa'am /

translated: At the time of the moon’s eclipse, in a stūpa containing relics, one should grind some somarājya fruits into a fine powder and make pills with ghee and honey.

analyzed: aa shvattha'i 'dab ma bdun gyi nang du btums nas lag pas mnan te ji srid 'bar ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //

analyzed: 'di ni las chen po thams cad kyi dngos grub byed pa zhes bya ba'i 'phags ma sgrol ma'i rig pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the noble Tara called the accomplisher of all great deeds.

original: de nas rig pa 'di rnams kyis mchog tu grub pa'i cho ga phyogs tsam du 'gyur te ji lta ji ltar rab tu sbyar ba de lta de ltar sgrub par byed do zhes pa de ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par bya'o; ;mdor na /
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'di rnams kyis mchog tu grub pa'i cho ga phyogs tsam du 'gyur te ji lta ji ltar rab tu sbyar ba de lta de ltar sgrub par byed do zhes pa de ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par bya'o; ;mdor na /
translated: Then, by these knowledge mantras, there will be a mere fraction of the ritual for supreme accomplishment. Just as it is applied, so it will be accomplished. It should be understood just as it is. In brief,

original: 'jigs pa chen po rnams dang / las phran tshegs rnams la'ang bklags pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa chen po rnams dang / las phran tshegs rnams la'ang bklags pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: in the case of great fears and minor deeds, it will be accomplished by recitation.🔽

original: cho ga 'di la'ang rig pa sgrub par 'dod pas rig pa des ba byung lngas lus kun tu sbyangs nas dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams te ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas thun gsum du stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga 'di la'ang rig pa sgrub par 'dod pas rig pa des ba byung lngas lus kun tu sbyangs nas dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams te ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas thun gsum du stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
translated: In this rite also, one who desires to accomplish the knowledge should purify the entire body with the five products of the cow, and beginning on the first lunar day, one should recite the mantra eight thousand times in three shifts, in the manner described.

original: ji srid du zla ba nya la 'bum yang rung ngo //
analyzed: ji srid du zla ba nya la 'bum yang rung ngo //
translated: Or one should recite one hundred thousand times on the full moon day.

original: sngon bsnyen pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon bsnyen pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will have done the preliminary practice.

original: de nas mthar nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas aa ga ru nag po'i yam shing sor drug pa'i tshad la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'am /
analyzed: de nas mthar nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas aa ga ru nag po'i yam shing sor drug pa'i tshad la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'am /
translated: Then, at the end, having fasted for one day and one night and performed extensive worship, one should offer into the fire of cutch tree sticks, six fingerbreadths long, smeared with curds, honey, and ghee,

original: du ru ska'i til mar gyis btags pa'i seng ldeng gi me la stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: du ru ska'i til mar gyis btags pa'i seng ldeng gi me la stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: or into the fire of cutch tree sticks smeared with sesame oil, one thousand and eight oblations.

original: las thams cad nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las thams cad nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be able to perform all activities.

original: de nas las su 'gyur te mthar mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pa /
analyzed: de nas las su 'gyur te mthar mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pa /
translated: Then, one should perform the activity. At the end, having fasted for three nights,

original: gzhon nu mas bkal ba'i skud pa ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i @277a *//
analyzed: gzhon nu mas bkal ba'i skud pa ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i @277a *//
translated: The long thread that the young woman wove was also filled with relics.🔽

original: mchod rten du'am /
analyzed: mchod rten du'am /
translated: “One should incant a long thread spun by a young girl, together with relics,🔽and tie it around one’s arm ten thousand times in front of a caitya.

original: so so'i khyim du stong phrag bcur mngon par sngags nas lag pa la bcings na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so'i khyim du stong phrag bcur mngon par sngags nas lag pa la bcings na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become invisible.🔽“One should install the painting in a caitya containing relics, and offer thirty thousand lotuses.

original: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du ras ris bzhugs su gsol nas padma stong phrag sum cu seng ldeng gi sol bas me sbar nas sbyin sreg byas na rang gi gzugs kyi lha mo mthong ngo //
analyzed: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du ras ris bzhugs su gsol nas padma stong phrag sum cu seng ldeng gi sol bas me sbar nas sbyin sreg byas na rang gi gzugs kyi lha mo mthong ngo //
translated: One will see the goddess in her own form.

original: gang blangs pa de rnyed do //
analyzed: gang blangs pa de rnyed do //
translated: One will obtain whatever one desires.

original: tshes gcig nas brtsams te ji srid bco lnga la mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten la mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas au dum b'a ra'i yam shing me sbar nas mar gyi sreg blugs stong sbyin sreg byas na
analyzed: tshes gcig nas brtsams te ji srid bco lnga la mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten la mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas au dum b'a ra'i yam shing me sbar nas mar gyi sreg blugs stong sbyin sreg byas na
translated: “Starting on the first day of a bright fortnight, for fifteen days one should observe silence and offer, in a caitya containing relics, a large pūjā, light a fire of cutch wood sticks, and offer one thousand oblations of ghee.

original: grong rnyed do //
analyzed: grong rnyed do //

original: rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu klung du mchod rten stong byed du gzhug go /
analyzed: rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu klung du mchod rten stong byed du gzhug go /
translated: One should cause a thousand stūpas to be made in a river that flows into the ocean.

original: nyi ma so so re re la mchod rten la stong phrag brgyad mngon par sngags pas dri dang / me tog la sogs pa 'di la phul nas ji srid du mchod rten phyi ma 'bar ba de nas bcom ldan 'das byon par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma so so re re la mchod rten la stong phrag brgyad mngon par sngags pas dri dang / me tog la sogs pa 'di la phul nas ji srid du mchod rten phyi ma 'bar ba de nas bcom ldan 'das byon par shes par bya'o //
translated: Every day, one should offer to the stūpas, with the mantra repeated eight thousand times, incense, flowers, and so forth. When the next stūpa blazes, one should know that the Blessed One has arrived.

original: bcom ldan 'das byon pa nas g-yo ba dang / dri zhim po'i rlung ldang ste ji srid du rang gi gzugs kyis nye bar gnas pa de srid du bzlas par ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byon pa nas g-yo ba dang / dri zhim po'i rlung ldang ste ji srid du rang gi gzugs kyis nye bar gnas pa de srid du bzlas par ba'o //
translated: When the Blessed One has arrived, a fragrant breeze will blow, and one should recite the mantra until one’s own form appears.

original: mchog gang blangs pa'i mchog stsol bar mdzad do //
analyzed: mchog gang blangs pa'i mchog stsol bar mdzad do //
translated: He will grant whatever boon one has requested.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar seng ldeng gi 'dab ma'i dum bu'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar seng ldeng gi 'dab ma'i dum bu'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: In front of the Blessed One, one should offer into the fire sticks of cutch tree wood, one thousand and eight times.

original: @277b nyi ma so sor grong re re rnyed do //
analyzed: @277b nyi ma so sor grong re re rnyed do //
translated: Every day, one will obtain a village.

original: dgon par song nas rig pa bye ba bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: dgon par song nas rig pa bye ba bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having gone to a solitary place, one should recite the vidyā ten million times.

original: slong mo bza' zhing zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i dgon pa'i ba lang gi lcibs sbyin sreg stong phrag nyi shu bya'o //
analyzed: slong mo bza' zhing zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i dgon pa'i ba lang gi lcibs sbyin sreg stong phrag nyi shu bya'o //
translated: One should beg for alms and offer into the fire twenty thousand oblations of forest cow dung mixed with curd, honey, and ghee.

original: ji srid lha rnams ri dvags mo'i gzugs su byas nas 'ong bar 'gyur te de la 'jigs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid lha rnams ri dvags mo'i gzugs su byas nas 'ong bar 'gyur te de la 'jigs par mi bya'o //
translated: Until the gods come in the form of a doe. One should not be afraid of her.

original: de'ang gter stsol bar byed de blang bar bya'o; ;rang nyid longs shig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'ang gter stsol bar byed de blang bar bya'o; ;rang nyid longs shig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: She will reveal a treasure, which one should accept. She will say, “Take it yourself.”

original: rgyal srid dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / rin po che rnams ster bar byed de rtag tu dkon mchog gsum la sbyar zhing bcom ldan 'das la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal srid dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / rin po che rnams ster bar byed de rtag tu dkon mchog gsum la sbyar zhing bcom ldan 'das la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: She will give kingdoms, wealth, grain, and jewels. One should always offer them to the Three Jewels and present them to the Blessed One.

original: dgon par zhugs nas rig pa stong phrag brgya bzlas par bya zhing aa ga ru'i shing la rab tu gnas pa'i spyan sngar bcom ldan 'das la shing pa tsha landi ka la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong byas na 'dod 'jo'i ba ser skyar 'ong ngo //
analyzed: dgon par zhugs nas rig pa stong phrag brgya bzlas par bya zhing aa ga ru'i shing la rab tu gnas pa'i spyan sngar bcom ldan 'das la shing pa tsha landi ka la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong byas na 'dod 'jo'i ba ser skyar 'ong ngo //
translated: Having entered a temple, one should recite the mantra one hundred thousand times. In front of the image of the Blessed One, consecrated on an aloe wood tree, one should offer one thousand oblations of pāṭalā flowers smeared with curds, honey, and ghee. The wish-fulfilling golden cow will come.

original: slar yang patsha lindi k'a'i sbyin sreg stong phrag nyi shu bya'o; ;'ongs nas kyang grub par 'gyur par te lo stong du 'o ma sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: slar yang patsha lindi k'a'i sbyin sreg stong phrag nyi shu bya'o; ;'ongs nas kyang grub par 'gyur par te lo stong du 'o ma sbyin par byed do //
translated: Again, one should offer twenty thousand oblations of pāṭalā flowers. Having come, she will grant accomplishment, and for one thousand years she will provide milk.

original: sngar brjod pa'i ras ris kyi spyan sngar mar dang / sbrang rtsis btags pa'i sna ma'i me tog gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i ras ris kyi spyan sngar mar dang / sbrang rtsis btags pa'i sna ma'i me tog gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: In front of the previously described painting, one should offer eight thousand oblations of jasmine flowers smeared with ghee and honey.

original: zla ba drug tu dong rtse stong rnyed do //
analyzed: zla ba drug tu dong rtse stong rnyed do //
translated: For six months one will obtain one thousand kārṣāpaṇas.

original: yang na pan stong lhag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: yang na pan stong lhag pa dang bcas pa'o //

original: ku mu da'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: ku mu da'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: One should offer eight thousand oblations of night-blooming jasmine flowers.

original: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i @278a *//
analyzed: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i @278a *//

original: mchod rten dang / sangs rgyas la mngon par dad pas lha rnams mchog sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: mchod rten dang / sangs rgyas la mngon par dad pas lha rnams mchog sbyin par byed do //
translated: The gods will grant boons to one who has faith in the Buddha.🔽Having made offerings to the noble Avalokiteśvara, one should incant white mustard seeds seven times and scatter them in battle.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la mchod pa byas nas yungs kar dkar po la lan bdun mngon par sngags par byas nas g-yul du gtor bar byas te 'di nyid stong phrag bzlas pas sems can thams cad dbang du byed nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la mchod pa byas nas yungs kar dkar po la lan bdun mngon par sngags par byas nas g-yul du gtor bar byas te 'di nyid stong phrag bzlas pas sems can thams cad dbang du byed nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting this mantra one thousand times, one will be able to enthrall all beings.

original: cho 'phrul gyi phyogs kyi dkar po'i bcu gsum la dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pas mchod pa byas nas me tog kha bye ba dang / mar gyi sreg blugs kyis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: cho 'phrul gyi phyogs kyi dkar po'i bcu gsum la dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pas mchod pa byas nas me tog kha bye ba dang / mar gyi sreg blugs kyis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: On the thirteenth day of the bright fortnight of the month of Caitra, having made offerings of perfume, flowers, and incense, one should recite the mantra eight thousand times, using opened flowers and offering oblations of ghee.

original: thal ba blangs nas gzhan gyi dpral bar thig le byas te grong dang / grong khyer du rab tu 'jug par byed de thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thal ba blangs nas gzhan gyi dpral bar thig le byas te grong dang / grong khyer du rab tu 'jug par byed de thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Taking the ashes, one should make a mark on one’s forehead and enter a village or town; everyone will be enthralled.

original: nag po'i bcu bzhi nas ji srid bco lnga'i bar du zhag gcig smyung bar gnas pas pa ta'i shing gi 'og tu dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa nye bar byugs te dri dang / bdug pa phul nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la mchod pa bya zhing gnod sbyin rnams la gtor ma phul te mi'i rus pa blangs nas rtse gsum byed du gzhug go /
analyzed: nag po'i bcu bzhi nas ji srid bco lnga'i bar du zhag gcig smyung bar gnas pas pa ta'i shing gi 'og tu dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa nye bar byugs te dri dang / bdug pa phul nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la mchod pa bya zhing gnod sbyin rnams la gtor ma phul te mi'i rus pa blangs nas rtse gsum byed du gzhug go /
translated: On the fourteenth day of the dark [fortnight], having fasted for one day and one night, he should anoint the ground with cow dung under a pāṭala tree, offer incense and perfume, make offerings to Ārya Avalokiteśvara, offer sacrificial cakes to the yakṣas, and have a trident made from human bone.

original: lag pa g-yon pas lan bdun 'phangs pa mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas sna ma'i me tog gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rtse gsum 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pas lan bdun 'phangs pa mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas sna ma'i me tog gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rtse gsum 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having cast it with his left hand seven times, having fasted for three nights, and having made eight thousand oblations of jasmine flowers, the trident will blaze.

original: de @278b nas grub par 'gyur te 'dod pas gang sprul pa der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de @278b nas grub par 'gyur te 'dod pas gang sprul pa der 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having become accomplished, he will become whatever he emanates.

original: lha'i khang par zla ba dang / nyi ma gzas bzung ba na ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten nam /
analyzed: lha'i khang par zla ba dang / nyi ma gzas bzung ba na ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten nam /
translated: In a divine palace, when the sun or moon is eclipsed, in a stūpa containing relics,

original: sku gzugs kyi khang par ser skyar rgyud mtshungs pa'i mar srang cig blangs nas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du gser gyi snod du bzhag nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas te zla ba mi lta ba nyid du ku shas steng nas g-yogs te bzlas
analyzed: sku gzugs kyi khang par ser skyar rgyud mtshungs pa'i mar srang cig blangs nas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du gser gyi snod du bzhag nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas te zla ba mi lta ba nyid du ku shas steng nas g-yogs te bzlas
translated: He should recite the mantra until the moon is eclipsed, covering himself with kuśa grass.

original: pa bya'o // dro bzhin pa na btung bar bya //🔽sems can thams cad dbang du byed do //
analyzed: pa bya'o // dro bzhin pa na btung bar bya // sems can thams cad dbang du byed do //
translated: If it becomes warm, he should drink it.

original: lci ba byung ba na btung par bya ste mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lci ba byung ba na btung par bya ste mi snang bar 'gyur ro //

original: 'bar bzhin pa na btung bar bya ste nam mkha' la 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'bar bzhin pa na btung bar bya ste nam mkha' la 'gro'o //
translated: If it smokes, he should drink it. He will fly up into the sky.🔽If it blazes, he should drink it. He will become a vidyādhara.

original: zla ba drug tu sngon spyad pa byas pa ba'i gcin dang / nas zan bza' zhing mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba drug tu sngon spyad pa byas pa ba'i gcin dang / nas zan bza' zhing mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs spyad par bya'o //
translated: For six months he should eat barley and drink cow’s urine, observing silence and celibacy.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma rtag tu bzlas pas ma blangs par gser brgya rnyed do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rtag tu bzlas pas ma blangs par gser brgya rnyed do //
translated: By constantly reciting the Blessed One, he will obtain a hundred dinars without having to ask for them.

original: cho 'phrul gyi phyogs kyi lor brtsam par bya ste 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar mchod pa byas nas dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa legs pa de bzhin du phul te yan lag brgyad kyi gso sbyong dang yang dag par ldan pas lo rdzogs pa na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cho 'phrul gyi phyogs kyi lor brtsam par bya ste 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar mchod pa byas nas dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa legs pa de bzhin du phul te yan lag brgyad kyi gso sbyong dang yang dag par ldan pas lo rdzogs pa na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, one should complete the year endowed with the eight-branched fasting observance.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ras ris 'ching bar byed do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ras ris 'ching bar byed do //
translated: The Blessed One will bind the painting.

original: bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas nas tshes gcig nas brtsams te ji srid zla ba nya ba'i @279a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas nas tshes gcig nas brtsams te ji srid zla ba nya ba'i @279a *//
translated: Having made offerings to the Blessed One, one should commence on the first day and continue until the full moon.🔽One should make the most excellent offerings and eat alms-food. One will attain accomplishment.

original: bar ches lhag pa'i mchod pa dang / slong mo bza' bar bya ste grub bo zhes pa'i tshig 'don par byed do //
analyzed: bar ches lhag pa'i mchod pa dang / slong mo bza' bar bya ste grub bo zhes pa'i tshig 'don par byed do //

original: mar gyi sreg blugs stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg byas pas pha rol zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mar gyi sreg blugs stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg byas pas pha rol zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By offering one thousand and eight oblations of ghee, one will pacify the enemy.

original: cho 'phrul gyi phyogs la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas la 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa la sogs pa de bzhin du phul nas dung gi me tog can gyi me tog stong phrag brgya la ai gu ta'i til mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg bya ste grong dang /
analyzed: cho 'phrul gyi phyogs la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas la 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa la sogs pa de bzhin du phul nas dung gi me tog can gyi me tog stong phrag brgya la ai gu ta'i til mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg bya ste grong dang /
translated: Then one should offer into the fire one hundred thousand flowers of the conch-shell jasmine tree smeared with ghee from the udumbara plant.

original: grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / ba lang dang / ma he rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //🔽de nas yang bra dbab par byed par 'dod na mtshan mo bdun du 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' zhing mtshan mo gcig tu gso sbyong dang ldan pas dri ma med pa'i mar gyi lhung bzed bkang nas dkar po'i mar sar gyis mar me sbar nas gzhon nu'am /
analyzed: grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / ba lang dang / ma he rnams dbang du 'gyur ro // de nas yang bra dbab par byed par 'dod na mtshan mo bdun du 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' zhing mtshan mo gcig tu gso sbyong dang ldan pas dri ma med pa'i mar gyi lhung bzed bkang nas dkar po'i mar sar gyis mar me sbar nas gzhon nu'am /
translated: One will subjugate the villages, towns, and countries, as well as the elephants, horses, cows, and buffaloes.🔽“If one wants to perform the rite of summoning, one should eat a diet of milk and barley for seven nights and, on the first night of the bright fortnight, observe the purificatory fast.

original: gzhon nu ma la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma la bstan par bya'o //
translated: One should fill a begging bowl with pure ghee and light a lamp with pure white beeswax.

original: de nyid du ras ris bzhugs nas ku sha bting ba la nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid du ras ris bzhugs nas ku sha bting ba la nyal bar bya'o //
translated: The painting should be placed there, and one should sleep on a spread of kuśa grass.

original: rmi lam du rdzas stong phrag nyi shu mthong //
analyzed: rmi lam du rdzas stong phrag nyi shu mthong //
translated: In one’s dream one will see twenty thousand substances.

original: ngo; ;cha phyed dkon mchog gsum la sbyar bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: ngo; ;cha phyed dkon mchog gsum la sbyar bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: Half of them should be offered to the Three Jewels.”

original: ras ris kyi spyan sngar dkar po'i tshes gcig nas pas brtsams te ji srid zla ba nya'i bar du nyi ma re re la sbyin sreg @279b stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: ras ris kyi spyan sngar dkar po'i tshes gcig nas pas brtsams te ji srid zla ba nya'i bar du nyi ma re re la sbyin sreg @279b stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: In front of the painting, beginning on the first day of the bright fortnight, one should perform eight thousand oblations daily until the full moon.

original: dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings of perfume, flowers, incense, and so forth.

original: mthar mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs spyad de rig pa bzlas par byas la cho 'phrul gyi phyogs nas lam po cher song la 'byung po'i blang du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: mthar mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs spyad de rig pa bzlas par byas la cho 'phrul gyi phyogs nas lam po cher song la 'byung po'i blang du gnas par bya'o //
translated: In the end, having fasted for three nights, one should observe silence and recite the vidyā. One should go to the crossroads and stay there in the place of the bhūta spirits.

original: rab tu stsol cig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu stsol cig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say, ‘Give me a boon.’

original: yungs kar bre ru blangs nas lan nyi shu rtsa gcig tu mngon par sngags nas phyogs bcu dang / 'og tu gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: yungs kar bre ru blangs nas lan nyi shu rtsa gcig tu mngon par sngags nas phyogs bcu dang / 'og tu gtor bar bya'o //
translated: Having taken mustard seed, one should enchant it twenty-one times and scatter it in the ten directions and below.

original: mchog bdag nyid la ston par byed de /
analyzed: mchog bdag nyid la ston par byed de /
translated: He will show himself to the practitioner.

original: de bzhin du nag po'i brgyad pa la dri gtsang khang du zhugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar rig pa stong du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nag po'i brgyad pa la dri gtsang khang du zhugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar rig pa stong du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, on the eighth day of the dark fortnight, having entered the fragrant chamber, one should recite the vidya one thousand times in front of the Blessed One.

original: dri dang / me tog la sogs pa dang / gtor ma'i cho ga byas nas de nas rim lam du bcom ldan 'das ral pa'i cod pan byas pa mthong bar byed do //
analyzed: dri dang / me tog la sogs pa dang / gtor ma'i cho ga byas nas de nas rim lam du bcom ldan 'das ral pa'i cod pan byas pa mthong bar byed do //
translated: Having performed the rite of the bali offering with perfumes, flowers, and so forth, then in the middle of the night one will behold the Blessed One with a topknot of matted hair.

original: sa ga'i zla ba dkar po'i phyogs la 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' zhing ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten la dri dang / me tog la sogs pas mchod pa byas nas nyi ma re re la ston mo bya'o //
analyzed: sa ga'i zla ba dkar po'i phyogs la 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' zhing ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten la dri dang / me tog la sogs pas mchod pa byas nas nyi ma re re la ston mo bya'o //
translated: On the bright fortnight of the month of Magha, subsisting on a diet of milk and barley, one should make offerings to a stupa containing relics with perfumes, flowers, and so forth, and make a feast offering each day.

original: chus gang ba'i bum pa bzhi sman dang / sa bon thams cad kyis yongs su bkang ba byas nas gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: chus gang ba'i bum pa bzhi sman dang / sa bon thams cad kyis yongs su bkang ba byas nas gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should fill four vases with water and all the medicines and seeds, and place them.

original: mtshan mo re re la stong phrag brgyad du mngon par sngags par byas nas bya rog gi tshang du bu byung gi bar khye'u dang / bu mo bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo re re la stong phrag brgyad du mngon par sngags par byas nas bya rog gi tshang du bu byung gi bar khye'u dang / bu mo bkru bar bya'o //
translated: Every night, one should bathe the boy and girl with the water from the vases, incanting it eight thousand times, until the crow has her young.

original: rgyal srid kyi don nam /
analyzed: rgyal srid kyi don nam /
translated: For the sake of a kingdom,

original: @280a *// longs spyod kyi don zla ba phyed kyi nang du 'grub bo //
analyzed: @280a *// longs spyod kyi don zla ba phyed kyi nang du 'grub bo //
translated: or for the sake of wealth, it will be accomplished within half a month.

original: nag po'i brgyad pa la bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas nas dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa la sogs pa dbul bar byas nas 'o ma can gyi shing gi yam shing gi me sbar te me tog brgya pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: nag po'i brgyad pa la bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas nas dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa la sogs pa dbul bar byas nas 'o ma can gyi shing gi yam shing gi me sbar te me tog brgya pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: On the eighth day of the dark fortnight, having made offerings to the Blessed One, having offered perfume, flowers, incense, and so forth, one should light a fire with sticks from a milk tree, and offer into it one thousand and eight oblations of flowers.

original: zla ba gcig tu bza' ba dang / btung ba mi zad pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zla ba gcig tu bza' ba dang / btung ba mi zad pa 'byung ngo //
translated: For one month, inexhaustible food and drink will appear.

original: dur khrod kyi thal ba blangs nas lan bdun mngon par bzlas te bdag nyid kyi dpral ba'am /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi thal ba blangs nas lan bdun mngon par bzlas te bdag nyid kyi dpral ba'am /
translated: Taking charnel ground ash, one should enchant it seven times and apply it to one’s forehead

original: gzhan gyi mgo bor btab par byas nas grong du zhugs na thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi mgo bor btab par byas nas grong du zhugs na thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: or to the head of another. If one enters a village, all will be enthralled.

original: bzlas pas 'ching ba la sgrol bar byed do //
analyzed: bzlas pas 'ching ba la sgrol bar byed do //
translated: By recitation, one will liberate those bound.

original: gtan pa gcog par byed do //
analyzed: gtan pa gcog par byed do //

original: lpags bdun nyams par byed do //
analyzed: lpags bdun nyams par byed do //
translated: One will destroy the seven skins.

original: m'a le ka'i me tog la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya'o //
analyzed: m'a le ka'i me tog la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya'o //
translated: One should offer into the fire one thousand oblations of jasmine flowers smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: ba lang gi gcin dang / nas zan za zhing zla ba drug tu 'dod pa bzhin du dong rtse rnyed do //
analyzed: ba lang gi gcin dang / nas zan za zhing zla ba drug tu 'dod pa bzhin du dong rtse rnyed do //
translated: Eating barley gruel mixed with cow’s urine, one will obtain one thousand gold coins in six months, as desired.

original: dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams te autpa la sngon po'i snying po'i sbyin sreg stong bya ste ming nas smos te nyi ma bdun la dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams te autpa la sngon po'i snying po'i sbyin sreg stong bya ste ming nas smos te nyi ma bdun la dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Beginning on the first day of the bright fortnight, one should offer one thousand oblations of blue lotus flowers. By mentioning the name, one will enthrall in seven days.

original: tsam pa ka dang / karni ka'i dus gsum du sbyin sreg bya zhing ming nas smos na gang 'dod pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsam pa ka dang / karni ka'i dus gsum du sbyin sreg bya zhing ming nas smos na gang 'dod pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the name of the one whom one desires to enthrall, he will be enthralled.

original: cho 'phrul gyi phyogs la 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing dus @280b gsum du stong phrag brgyad du bzlas pa dang / ras ris kyi spyan sngar aa ga ru'i yam shing gis 'bum phrag gsum du sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: cho 'phrul gyi phyogs la 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing dus @280b gsum du stong phrag brgyad du bzlas pa dang / ras ris kyi spyan sngar aa ga ru'i yam shing gis 'bum phrag gsum du sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: On the side of miracles, one should eat milk and barley meal, and recite [the mantra] three times a day for eight thousand [recitations]. In front of the painting, one should offer into the fire three hundred thousand oblations of sticks of agaru wood.🔽One should commence the rite of pacification until the Blessed One arrives.

original: bco lnga las grub ba la rab tu 'jug ste ji srid bcom ldan 'das byon pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: bco lnga las grub ba la rab tu 'jug ste ji srid bcom ldan 'das byon pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite [the mantra] for as long as the Blessed One arrives.

original: sa g-yo ba'am /
analyzed: sa g-yo ba'am /

original: mar me'i rtse mo 'phel ba'am /🔽ras ris g-yo bar byed pa dang grub bo //🔽grub bo zhes tshig 'don par byed na rgyal srid dam /
analyzed: mar me'i rtse mo 'phel ba'am / ras ris g-yo bar byed pa dang grub bo // grub bo zhes tshig 'don par byed na rgyal srid dam /
translated: the flame of the lamp will increase,🔽and the painting will move.🔽If one says, “It is accomplished,” one will obtain a kingdom

original: yul gyi bdag po nyid rnyed do //
analyzed: yul gyi bdag po nyid rnyed do //
translated: or the status of a king of a region.

original: sngon spyad pa byas pas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar zla ba drug gi nang du stong phrag lnga so sor rnyed do //
analyzed: sngon spyad pa byas pas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar zla ba drug gi nang du stong phrag lnga so sor rnyed do //
translated: In front of Ārya Avalokiteśvara in a caitya containing relics, one will obtain five hundred [measures of] silver in six months by the power of previous practice.

original: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten la mchod pa byas nas stong phrag brgya bzlas par byas te dngul stong rnyed do //
analyzed: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten la mchod pa byas nas stong phrag brgya bzlas par byas te dngul stong rnyed do //
translated: Having made offerings to a caitya containing relics, one should recite [the mantra] one thousand times; one will obtain one thousand silver coins.

original: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten la stong phrag brgya bzlas bar bya'o //
analyzed: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten la stong phrag brgya bzlas bar bya'o //
translated: One should recite [the mantra] one thousand times in a caitya containing relics.

original: 'dod pa thams cad rab tu sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad rab tu sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will obtain all that one desires.

original: nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar 'dod pas gzhon nu mas bkal ba'i srad bu la stong phrag brgyad mngon par sngags par byas nas blangs nas bskor ba bya ste skal ba bzang po nyid rnyed do //
analyzed: nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar 'dod pas gzhon nu mas bkal ba'i srad bu la stong phrag brgyad mngon par sngags par byas nas blangs nas bskor ba bya ste skal ba bzang po nyid rnyed do //
translated: One who desires the pacification of all diseases should enchant a thread spun by a young girl eight hundred times, take it, and tie it around one's head; one will obtain good fortune.

original: rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu klung du zhugs nas til nag po la stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya ste srad bu can dang / til dang / sol ba nyid do //
analyzed: rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu klung du zhugs nas til nag po la stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya ste srad bu can dang / til dang / sol ba nyid do //
translated: Having entered a river that flows into the ocean, one should recite [the mantra] eight thousand times over black sesame seeds.

original: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du dkar po'i tshe @281a *//
analyzed: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du dkar po'i tshe @281a *//
translated: In a stūpa containing relics, during the bright fortnight,

original: gcig nas brtsams nas bco lnga la mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas au dum b'a ra'i shing gis me sbar nas yungs kar dkar po la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya'o //
analyzed: gcig nas brtsams nas bco lnga la mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas au dum b'a ra'i shing gis me sbar nas yungs kar dkar po la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya'o //
translated: having fasted for three nights, beginning with one [night fast] up to fifteen [night fasts], one should light a fire with udumbara wood and offer into the fire one hundred thousand oblations of white mustard seeds smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: yul gru lnga'i dpon por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul gru lnga'i dpon por 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become the ruler of five villages.

original: byang chub shing gi yam shing gis me sbar nas til la zho dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub shing gi yam shing gis me sbar nas til la zho dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya'o //
translated: Having lit a fire with sticks from a bodhi tree, one should offer one hundred thousand oblations of sesame seeds smeared with curds, ghee, and honey.

original: bco lnga la mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pa byas nas gal te til de rnams phyogs dang; phyogs bral du song na de'i tshe grub pa yin te sems can thams cad dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bco lnga la mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pa byas nas gal te til de rnams phyogs dang; phyogs bral du song na de'i tshe grub pa yin te sems can thams cad dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If, after fasting for three nights on the fifteenth day of the lunar month, the sesame seeds move away from each other in all directions, then one will be successful and will enthrall all sentient beings.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar sngon du stong phrag brgya bzlas te zla ba gzas bzung ba na til mar lan bdun cu phul nas ji srid wu ba 'byung ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar sngon du stong phrag brgya bzlas te zla ba gzas bzung ba na til mar lan bdun cu phul nas ji srid wu ba 'byung ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: In front of Noble Avalokiteśvara, one should first recite [the mantra] one hundred thousand times. When there is an eclipse of the moon, one should offer sesame oil one hundred and seventy times, and recite [the mantra] as long as foam appears.

original: 'thungs na thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thungs na thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one drinks it, one will retain what one has learned.

original: kun du ru skal stong phrag brgya bzlas nas blangs na grong gcig rnyed do //
analyzed: kun du ru skal stong phrag brgya bzlas nas blangs na grong gcig rnyed do //
translated: If one takes [the oil] after reciting [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, one will obtain a village.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar nyi ma so sor brgyad brgyar bzlas par bya ste dpal dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar nyi ma so sor brgyad brgyar bzlas par bya ste dpal dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In front of Noble Avalokiteśvara, one should recite [the mantra] eight hundred times each day. One will become glorious.

original: aa p'a marga'i yam shing la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags te nyi ma so sor sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas @281b na grong rnyed do //
analyzed: aa p'a marga'i yam shing la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags te nyi ma so sor sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas @281b na grong rnyed do //
translated: If one offers into the fire, every day, eight thousand sticks of the apāmārga plant smeared with curds, honey, and ghee, one will obtain a village.

original: bu mang po can gyi yam shing la me sbar nas shu dag stong phrag brgyad du sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: bu mang po can gyi yam shing la me sbar nas shu dag stong phrag brgyad du sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: If one lights a fire with sticks of the plant of many sons and offers into it one thousand and eight oblations of white mustard seeds,

original: thal ba des thig le bya'o //
analyzed: thal ba des thig le bya'o //
translated: one should make a mark with that ash.

original: mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi snang bar 'gyur ro //

original: gal te ma gyur na lan gsum du yang bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te ma gyur na lan gsum du yang bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: If one does not succeed, one should perform the ritual again three times.

original: zla ba gzas bzung ba na chu klung gi 'gram du song nas bil ba'i yam shing gis me sbar nas bil ba'i me tog la mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya byas na gnod sbyin gzhon nu 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba gzas bzung ba na chu klung gi 'gram du song nas bil ba'i yam shing gis me sbar nas bil ba'i me tog la mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya byas na gnod sbyin gzhon nu 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the moon is seized by Rāhu, one should go to the bank of a river, light a fire with sticks of the bilva tree, and offer into it one hundred thousand oblations of bilva flowers smeared with ghee. A young yakṣa will come.

original: mtshan mo phyed na rig pa stong phrag bzlas nas de nas gcig 'ong bar byed de gter rnams sam; nor gyi bdag po gang tshig gis brjod de byed do //
analyzed: mtshan mo phyed na rig pa stong phrag bzlas nas de nas gcig 'ong bar byed de gter rnams sam; nor gyi bdag po gang tshig gis brjod de byed do //
translated: At midnight, having recited the vidyā one thousand times, one will cause one of them to come. He will say, ‘What treasure or lord of wealth shall I bring?’

original: nag po'i brgyad pa la bcom ldan 'das la dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa byas nas nag po'i bcu bzhi pa la gtor ma'i cho ga bya ste rig pa stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: nag po'i brgyad pa la bcom ldan 'das la dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa byas nas nag po'i bcu bzhi pa la gtor ma'i cho ga bya ste rig pa stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
translated: “On the eighth day of the dark fortnight, having worshipped the Blessed One with incense, flowers, and perfume, on the fourteenth one should perform the bali rite and recite the vidyā eight thousand times.

original: sha za rnams 'ong bar byed do //
analyzed: sha za rnams 'ong bar byed do //
translated: One will cause the piśācas to come.

original: gter rkos shig ces brjod par bya'o; ;de nas gter stsol bar byed de blangs nas bdag nyid dkon mchog gsum po rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gter rkos shig ces brjod par bya'o; ;de nas gter stsol bar byed de blangs nas bdag nyid dkon mchog gsum po rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should say, ‘Dig up the treasure!’ Then he will bring the treasure. Having taken it, one should offer it to the Three Jewels.

original: de bzhin du ras ris bcing ba'i las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar ba ru ra'i shing gis me sbar nas nyi ma so sor til dang / 'bras thug po che'i sbyin sreg stong bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ras ris bcing ba'i las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar ba ru ra'i shing gis me sbar nas nyi ma so sor til dang / 'bras thug po che'i sbyin sreg stong bya'o //
translated: “In the same way, one should perform the rite of binding the painting in front of the Blessed One, having lit a fire of cutch tree sticks. Every day one should offer into the fire one thousand oblations of sesame and rice.

original: blon po dbang du byed pa la yungs kar dkar @282a *//🔽po'i sbyin sreg gis dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blon po dbang du byed pa la yungs kar dkar @282a *// po'i sbyin sreg gis dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: To enthrall a minister, make a homa of white mustard seeds.🔽 He will be enthralled.

original: sra rtsi pog gi sbyin sreg gis rgyal po dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sra rtsi pog gi sbyin sreg gis rgyal po dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: To enthrall a king, make a homa of lac.

original: bud med dang / skyes ba dbang du byed pa la phub ma'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: bud med dang / skyes ba dbang du byed pa la phub ma'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: To enthrall a woman or a man, make an offering of eight thousand oblations of chaff.🔽 Having lit a fire with jujube wood, make a homa of jujube sticks in front of the Blessed One, a thousand oblations each day. One will obtain a hundred gold coins.🔽 Eating only alms, make a homa of palasha sticks three times a day. One will obtain a hundred gold coins each time.🔽 Having gone to the ocean, recite the vidya one hundred thousand times. As long as one wishes, one will obtain jewels.

original: aa ru ra'i shing gis me sbar nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar nyi ma so sor sgron shing gis sbyin sreg stong bya ste dong tse brgya rnyed do //
analyzed: aa ru ra'i shing gis me sbar nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar nyi ma so sor sgron shing gis sbyin sreg stong bya ste dong tse brgya rnyed do //
translated: One should take them and dedicate them to the Three Jewels.🔽 🔽 Having gone to the ocean, recite the vidya one hundred thousand times. As long as one wishes, one will obtain jewels.🔽 One should take them and dedicate them to the Three Jewels.🔽 🔽 Having gone to the ocean, recite the vidya one hundred thousand times. As long as one wishes, one will obtain jewels.

original: slong mo za bas nyi ma so sor dus gsum du pa l'a sha'i sbyin sreg bya ste gser brgya so sor rnyed do //
analyzed: slong mo za bas nyi ma so sor dus gsum du pa l'a sha'i sbyin sreg bya ste gser brgya so sor rnyed do //
translated: One should take them and dedicate them to the Three Jewels.🔽 🔽 Having gone to the ocean, recite the vidya one hundred thousand times. As long as one wishes, one will obtain jewels.🔽 One should take them and dedicate them to the Three Jewels.🔽 🔽 Having gone to the ocean, recite the vidya one hundred thousand times. As long as one wishes, one will obtain jewels.

original: rgya mtshor song nas rig pa stong phrag brgya bzla ste ji srid rin po che rnams sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: rgya mtshor song nas rig pa stong phrag brgya bzla ste ji srid rin po che rnams sbyin par byed do //
translated: One should take them and dedicate them to the Three Jewels.🔽 🔽 Having gone to the ocean, recite the vidya one hundred thousand times. As long as one wishes, one will obtain jewels.🔽 One should take them and dedicate them to the Three Jewels.🔽 🔽 Having gone to the ocean, recite the vidya one hundred thousand times. As long as one wishes, one will obtain jewels.

original: blang bar bya ste dkon mchog gsum la nges par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: blang bar bya ste dkon mchog gsum la nges par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should take them and dedicate them to the Three Jewels.🔽 🔽 Having gone to the ocean, recite the vidya one hundred thousand times. As long as one wishes, one will obtain jewels.🔽 One should take them and dedicate them to the Three Jewels.

original: sngags 'di nyid kyis sa ga'i zla ba nya ba la mtshan thog thag tu bzlas pa bar ma chad pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags 'di nyid kyis sa ga'i zla ba nya ba la mtshan thog thag tu bzlas pa bar ma chad pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: On the full moon of the month of Jyeṣṭha, one should recite this mantra continuously throughout the night.

original: byang chub kyi shing drung du bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas nas aa p'a marga'i yam shing la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing drung du bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas nas aa p'a marga'i yam shing la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: Having made an offering to the Blessed One in front of the Bodhi tree, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of sticks of the apāmārga plant smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: bdag nyid ston pa yungs kar gyis grol bar 'gyur ro //🔽zhi bar 'dod na 'bras yos kyi sreg blugs kyis sbyin sreg brgyad brgya byas na zhi bar 'gyur ro //🔽rgyas par 'dod na 'o ma can gyi yam shing gis me sbar nas til dang / 'bras thug po ches thun gsum du sbyin sreg brgyad @282b brgyar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ston pa yungs kar gyis grol bar 'gyur ro // zhi bar 'dod na 'bras yos kyi sreg blugs kyis sbyin sreg brgyad brgya byas na zhi bar 'gyur ro // rgyas par 'dod na 'o ma can gyi yam shing gis me sbar nas til dang / 'bras thug po ches thun gsum du sbyin sreg brgyad @282b brgyar bya'o //
translated: One will be freed from all one’s faults.🔽If one wants to pacify something, one should offer into the fire one hundred and eight oblations of parched rice.🔽If one wants to prosper, one should light a fire with sticks of the udumbara tree and offer into it three times a day oblations of sesame seeds and boiled rice, one thousand and eight times.

original: nyi ma gsum du aa mra'i yam shing gis me sbar nas dur bha dang / tsher ma can gyi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gsum du aa mra'i yam shing gis me sbar nas dur bha dang / tsher ma can gyi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: For three days one should light a fire with sticks of the mango tree and offer into it one thousand and eight oblations of durvā grass and thorns.

original: rtsod par 'dod pa rnams kyi smra ba'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsod par 'dod pa rnams kyi smra ba'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become the best of speakers among those who wish to debate.

original: nyi ma so sor 'bru rlon pa dang / phub ma rnams lag pa g-yon pas sbyin sreg byas na ming nas smos na mtshan mo bdun gyis dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma so sor 'bru rlon pa dang / phub ma rnams lag pa g-yon pas sbyin sreg byas na ming nas smos na mtshan mo bdun gyis dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers oblations of raw grain and chaff with one's left hand every day, one will enthrall anyone whose name one mentions within seven nights.

original: rgyal po'i yam shing gis me sbar nas til dang / 'bras thug po che'i sbyin sreg thun mtshams gsum du stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i yam shing gis me sbar nas til dang / 'bras thug po che'i sbyin sreg thun mtshams gsum du stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: One should light a fire with sticks of the royal punnaga tree and offer sesame seeds and parched grain into the flames one thousand and eight times in each of the three junctions of the day.

original: nyi ma gsum du aa mra'i yam shing gis me sbar nas dur bha dang / tsher ma can gyi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gsum du aa mra'i yam shing gis me sbar nas dur bha dang / tsher ma can gyi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: For three days one should light a fire with mango wood and offer durva grass and thorns into the flames one thousand and eight times.

original: nyi ma bdun gyis skyes bu chen po rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma bdun gyis skyes bu chen po rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Within seven days one will enthrall even the greatest of beings.

original: 'o ma dang / ba lang gi gcin dang / nas zan dang / bsod snyoms za ba'am /
analyzed: 'o ma dang / ba lang gi gcin dang / nas zan dang / bsod snyoms za ba'am /
translated: One should subsist on milk, cow's urine, barley, and alms.

original: mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs kun tu spyad cing gtsang mas gos gtsang ma dang / shing shun 'chang bas sgrub pa byas te gang g'ar gtun shing gi sgra dang bral ba gtsang ma'i phyogs su chu bo'i 'gram gnyis kyis blangs nas khru bdun pa'i sa'i gong bu bzhi byas nas dbus su 'dab ma stong gi padma byas te de'i steng du bde bar
analyzed: mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs kun tu spyad cing gtsang mas gos gtsang ma dang / shing shun 'chang bas sgrub pa byas te gang g'ar gtun shing gi sgra dang bral ba gtsang ma'i phyogs su chu bo'i 'gram gnyis kyis blangs nas khru bdun pa'i sa'i gong bu bzhi byas nas dbus su 'dab ma stong gi padma byas te de'i steng du bde bar
translated: He practiced the discipline of silence, was clean, wore clean clothes, and carried a wooden board. He practiced in the pure place of the Ganges, free from the sound of pestles, on both banks of the river. He took four lumps of earth seven cubits in size, made a thousand-petaled lotus in the center, and on top of that he made a seat of kuśa grass.🔽

original: gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad kyi lcags lnga las byas pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bzhag nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bris sku'i spyan sngar bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad kyi lcags lnga las byas pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bzhag nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bris sku'i spyan sngar bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: He should practice the vow of silence, be pure, wear clean clothes, and carry a piece of wood. Having performed the practice, he should go to the pure side of the Gaṅgā, free from the sound of pestles, and take four lumps of earth, seven cubits in size, from both banks of the river. In the middle, he should make a lotus with a thousand petals. On top of that, he should place a wheel made of the five metals, the size of a sugata's thumb. Having placed it in the center of the maṇḍala, he should perform the practice in front of the painted image.

original: dri zhim po'i dri @283a *//
analyzed: dri zhim po'i dri @283a *//
translated: He should offer incense of fragrant smells,

original: rnams dang / tsandan dkar dmar gyis mchod nas man d'a ra ba'i me tog dang / bdug pa dang / phreng ba brgya phul nas bcom ldan 'das la dri dang me tog dang / bdug pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: rnams dang / tsandan dkar dmar gyis mchod nas man d'a ra ba'i me tog dang / bdug pa dang / phreng ba brgya phul nas bcom ldan 'das la dri dang me tog dang / bdug pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa bya'o //
translated: red and white sandalwood, and offer a hundred māndārava flowers, incense, and garlands. He should make offerings to the Blessed One of incense, flowers, incense, and so forth.

original: mar gyi mar me'i phreng ba bdun dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: mar gyi mar me'i phreng ba bdun dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer seven rows of butter lamps.

original: phyogs bzhir mar gyi bum pa bzhi rab tu sbar bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs bzhir mar gyi bum pa bzhi rab tu sbar bar bya'o //
translated: Four butter lamps should be lit in the four directions.

original: phyogs bzhir bum pa bzhi sa bon thams cad kyis gang bar rin po che rnams bcug nas bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs bzhir bum pa bzhi sa bon thams cad kyis gang bar rin po che rnams bcug nas bzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the four directions, four vases filled with all the seeds should be placed, with jewels inserted.

original: aa ga ru dang / kun du ru ska dang / dpal rnams btags pa dang / gu gul gyi bdug pa dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: aa ga ru dang / kun du ru ska dang / dpal rnams btags pa dang / gu gul gyi bdug pa dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer incense of agaru, tagara, and sri, and incense of guggula.

original: gtor ma'i cho ga byas nas phyogs bzhir sngar brjod pa'i zho zan sngon ma can dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtor ma'i cho ga byas nas phyogs bzhir sngar brjod pa'i zho zan sngon ma can dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Having performed the rite of the bali offering, one should offer the previously mentioned curds and parched grain in the four directions.

original: lho ru ni na bhu taktra ra dar ba chu dang bsres pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: lho ru ni na bhu taktra ra dar ba chu dang bsres pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: In the south, one should offer water mixed with the three white foods.

original: byang phyogs su 'o thug gis gang ba'i gtor mas nye bar mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs su 'o thug gis gang ba'i gtor mas nye bar mchod par bya'o //
translated: In the north, one should make an offering of a bali filled with milk-rice.

original: sems can thams cad la phyogs bzhir rgyun mi 'chad pa 'byung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phyogs bzhir rgyun mi 'chad pa 'byung bar bya'o //
translated: In the four directions, one should make an offering of food for all beings.

original: p'a la sha'i yam shing gis me sbar nas aa p'a marga'i yam shing la mar gyis btags la lan bdun mngon par sngags te sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o; ;ming nas smos pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: p'a la sha'i yam shing gis me sbar nas aa p'a marga'i yam shing la mar gyis btags la lan bdun mngon par sngags te sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o; ;ming nas smos pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Having lit a fire with sticks of the palāśa tree, one should offer into it one thousand and eight oblations of sticks of the apāmārga tree smeared with ghee, each time incanting them seven times. The one whose name one utters will come under one’s control.

original: byang chub kyi yam shing gis me sbar nas lan tshva las byung ba'i gzugs brnyan byas te mgo bo nas brtsams te ji srid @283b rkang pa'i bar du sreg blugs re re la lan bdun bdun mngon par sngags pa byas nas sreg blugs stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yam shing gis me sbar nas lan tshva las byung ba'i gzugs brnyan byas te mgo bo nas brtsams te ji srid @283b rkang pa'i bar du sreg blugs re re la lan bdun bdun mngon par sngags pa byas nas sreg blugs stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: Having lit a fire with sticks of the bodhi tree, one should make an effigy out of salt and burn it, starting from the head and ending with the feet, each time incanting the oblation seven times and offering it one thousand and eight times.

original: ming nas smos pa'i rgyal po dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming nas smos pa'i rgyal po dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: The king whose name one utters will come under one’s control.

original: dkar po'i bco lnga la yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong can gyis nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas te sa la ma lhung ba'i ba byung gis ba lang gi lpags pa'i tshad kyis dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs nas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten dang
analyzed: dkar po'i bco lnga la yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong can gyis nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas te sa la ma lhung ba'i ba byung gis ba lang gi lpags pa'i tshad kyis dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs nas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten dang
translated: On the fifteenth day of the bright fortnight, having taken the poṣadha vow with its eight branches, one should fast for a day and night, anoint a maṇḍala the size of a bull’s hide with cow bezoar that has not fallen on the ground, and place a stūpa containing relics🔽and a painting of noble Avalokiteśvara in front of it.

original: / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zhabs kyi drung du gser dngul gyi snod du ser skyar rgyud mtshungs pa'i ba'i mar gzhon nu mas bsrubs pa blangs nas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug te lag pa g-yon pas snod bzung lag pa g-yas pa'i ming med
analyzed: / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zhabs kyi drung du gser dngul gyi snod du ser skyar rgyud mtshungs pa'i ba'i mar gzhon nu mas bsrubs pa blangs nas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug te lag pa g-yon pas snod bzung lag pa g-yas pa'i ming med
translated: Taking ghee from a cow that has calved only once, put it in a silver or golden vessel in front of the painting, and sit on a bundle of kuśa grass.

original: kyi sor mos dkrug par bya ste ji srid dro bar gyur pa de srid du'o //
analyzed: kyi sor mos dkrug par bya ste ji srid dro bar gyur pa de srid du'o //
translated: Holding the vessel with the left hand, stir the ghee with the ring finger of the right hand until it heats up.

original: de nas btung bar bya ste yid gzhungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas btung bar bya ste yid gzhungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then drink it; one will become intelligent.

original: lan gcig brjod pas thos pa 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: lan gcig brjod pas thos pa 'dzin par byed do //
translated: By reciting it once, one will retain what one hears.

original: de la du ba 'thul bas ni dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la du ba 'thul bas ni dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: By smoking it, one will enthrall.

original: 'bar bas ni mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bar bas ni mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By burning it, one will become invisible.

original: yan lag thams cad na ba nye bar zhi bar 'dod pas dkar po'i brgyad pa la gso sbyong can gyis snga dro las brtsams par bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag thams cad na ba nye bar zhi bar 'dod pas dkar po'i brgyad pa la gso sbyong can gyis snga dro las brtsams par bya'o //
translated: “One who wishes to alleviate all diseases should, on the eighth day of the bright fortnight, having fasted, begin the rite in the morning.

original: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su gzhu'i tshad kyi dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs nas dbus su nad pa'i so phag gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su gzhu'i tshad kyi dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs nas dbus su nad pa'i so phag gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Having anointed a maṇḍala the size of a bow-shot in the east and so forth, one should place a sick person in the center.

original: phyogs @284a *// bzhi rnams su bum pa chus gang ba bzhi la brgyad brgyar mngon par bzlas la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs @284a *// bzhi rnams su bum pa chus gang ba bzhi la brgyad brgyar mngon par bzlas la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the four directions, one should place four vases filled with water, enchanted eight hundred times.

original: so phag rnams kyi steng du sen rtsi'i go sa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: so phag rnams kyi steng du sen rtsi'i go sa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place a piece of lac on top of the bricks.

original: gzhon nu mas bkal ba'i tshon sna lnga'i skud pas yongs su dkris te dri zhim pos yongs su bkang bas so //
analyzed: gzhon nu mas bkal ba'i tshon sna lnga'i skud pas yongs su dkris te dri zhim pos yongs su bkang bas so //
translated: One should wrap it with a thread of five colors spun by a young girl, and fill it with perfume.

original: phyi rol du dkyil 'khor bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du dkyil 'khor bya'o //
translated: One should make a maṇḍala outside.

original: phyogs bzhir chang dang / sha'i gtor ma dbul lo //
analyzed: phyogs bzhir chang dang / sha'i gtor ma dbul lo //
translated: In the four directions, one should offer sacrificial cakes of wine and meat.

original: dri zhim po'i me tog gis mchod pa byas nas gu gul gyi dud ba dbul lo //
analyzed: dri zhim po'i me tog gis mchod pa byas nas gu gul gyi dud ba dbul lo //
translated: Having made offerings with fragrant flowers, one should offer the smoke of agalloch.

original: zangs kyi snod mar gyis bkang ba gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: zangs kyi snod mar gyis bkang ba gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place a copper vessel filled with ghee.

original: de nas ku sha ljang gu bzung nas nad pa gos dkar mo can la ji srid rkang pa'i bar du byab bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ku sha ljang gu bzung nas nad pa gos dkar mo can la ji srid rkang pa'i bar du byab bar bya'o //
translated: Then, taking green kuśa grass, one should stroke the patient, who should be wearing white clothes, as far as the feet.

original: mar gyi steng du ku sha dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: mar gyi steng du ku sha dor bar bya'o //
translated: The kuśa should be cast into the ghee.

original: de bzhin du brgya rtsa brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du brgya rtsa brgyad bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should do this one hundred and eight times.

original: de nas mar zos pas blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mar zos pas blta bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having eaten the ghee, one should look.

original: de nas ku sha ljang gu blangs nas zlos bzhin du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ku sha ljang gu blangs nas zlos bzhin du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Then, taking the green kuśa, one should place it while reciting.

original: sbyangs pa las 'byung ba'i snod dang / gos byas nas sangs rgyas dang; byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi zhabs la phyag byed du gzhug go /
analyzed: sbyangs pa las 'byung ba'i snod dang / gos byas nas sangs rgyas dang; byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi zhabs la phyag byed du gzhug go /
translated: Having made a vessel and clothes from the kuśa that has grown, one should make prostrations at the feet of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de nas pri yang ku dang / n'a ga ge sar dang / sbrang rtsi can dang / bzhi po cig tu byas nas mnyam par thob par byas la mar dang lhan cig pa'i zas mchog zos na nad med pa rang bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas pri yang ku dang / n'a ga ge sar dang / sbrang rtsi can dang / bzhi po cig tu byas nas mnyam par thob par byas la mar dang lhan cig pa'i zas mchog zos na nad med pa rang bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having made a single compound of priyaṅgu, nāga-kesara, and madhuka, and having obtained an equal portion, if one eats it together with ghee, one will be free from disease and will remain in good health.

original: skud pa sngon po la lan bdun mngon par sngags @284b pa byas nas rked pa la bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: skud pa sngon po la lan bdun mngon par sngags @284b pa byas nas rked pa la bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Having enchanted a blue thread seven times, one should tie it around one’s waist.

original: shu ba mched pa nye bar zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: shu ba mched pa nye bar zhi bar byed do //
translated: It will pacify the spreading of boils.

original: de bzhin du mgrin pa la nye bar bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mgrin pa la nye bar bcing bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should tie it around one’s throat.

original: dbugs mi bde ba nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbugs mi bde ba nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //

original: gso sbyong can gyis 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs nas dri bzang po'i me tog rnams kyis mchod pa byas te mar gyi mar me dbul lo //
analyzed: gso sbyong can gyis 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs nas dri bzang po'i me tog rnams kyis mchod pa byas te mar gyi mar me dbul lo //
translated: One who is observing the purificatory fast should anoint the maṇḍala in front of Noble Avalokiteśvara, make offerings with fragrant flowers, and offer ghee lamps.

original: de nas byang chub shing gis yam shing gis me rab tu sbar ro //
analyzed: de nas byang chub shing gis yam shing gis me rab tu sbar ro //
translated: Then, one should light a fire with sticks of the bodhi tree.

original: spar nas sra rtsi pog la lan bdun mngon par sngags pa'i sreg blugs stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: spar nas sra rtsi pog la lan bdun mngon par sngags pa'i sreg blugs stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Having ignited it, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of resin incense, having enchanted it with the mantra seven times.

original: nad nye bar zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: nad nye bar zhi bar byed do //

original: rig pas bgegs nye bar zhi bar byed /
analyzed: rig pas bgegs nye bar zhi bar byed /

original: 'dod pas rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu klung gi 'gram gnyis kyis blangs nas seng ge dang / stag dang / phag dang / lug gi gdong pa la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyi shu rtsa gcig lhag pa'i brgya bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu klung gi 'gram gnyis kyis blangs nas seng ge dang / stag dang / phag dang / lug gi gdong pa la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyi shu rtsa gcig lhag pa'i brgya bya'o //
translated: One should make one hundred and eight effigies of the various kinds of obstacles, such as lions, tigers, boars, sheep, and so on, with more than one hundred and twenty faces, taking clay from both banks of a river that flows into the ocean, and [one should make] a heap of sesame seeds.

original: de nas nag po'i brgyad pa la gso sbyong can gyis mtshan mo phyogs gtsang mar bla re dmar po bres la las yang dag par brtsam mo //
analyzed: de nas nag po'i brgyad pa la gso sbyong can gyis mtshan mo phyogs gtsang mar bla re dmar po bres la las yang dag par brtsam mo //
translated: Then, on the eighth day of the dark [fortnight], one who has taken the purificatory fast should perform the rite at night in a clean place, having hung up a red canopy.

original: sen rtsi'i gos bcu bzhi la bgegs gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sen rtsi'i gos bcu bzhi la bgegs gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place the obstacles on the fourteen [effigies].

original: dbus su bgegs rnams kyi gtso bo log 'dren gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dbus su bgegs rnams kyi gtso bo log 'dren gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the middle, one should place the chief of the obstacles, the tempter.

original: tshon sna lnga'i phye ma la lan gcig mngon par sngags pa rnams kyis dkyil 'khor bdun bya'o //
analyzed: tshon sna lnga'i phye ma la lan gcig mngon par sngags pa rnams kyis dkyil 'khor bdun bya'o //
translated: One should make seven maṇḍalas with the five-colored powders, each empowered once.

original: dri dmar po'i me tog rnams kyis mngon par mchod pa byas nas mar gyi mar me bcu bzhi dbul lo //🔽gu gul gyi bdug @285a *//
analyzed: dri dmar po'i me tog rnams kyis mngon par mchod pa byas nas mar gyi mar me bcu bzhi dbul lo // gu gul gyi bdug @285a *//
translated: Having made offerings with red-colored flowers, one should offer fourteen butter lamps.

original: pa dbul lo //🔽sha dang bcas pa'i gtor ma bcu bzhi dbul lo //
analyzed: pa dbul lo // sha dang bcas pa'i gtor ma bcu bzhi dbul lo //
translated: One should offer incense of agalloch.🔽One should offer fourteen bali offerings with meat.

original: rgya skyegs kyi khu ba'ang bcu bzhi gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgya skyegs kyi khu ba'ang bcu bzhi gtor bar bya'o //
translated: One should scatter fourteen parts of lac solution.

original: de nas srad bu dmar po la lan bdun mngon par sngags pas mtshan ma bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas srad bu dmar po la lan bdun mngon par sngags pas mtshan ma bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having empowered a red thread seven times, one should bind the signs.

original: 'byung po dang / bgegs kyi rgyal po'ang bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung po dang / bgegs kyi rgyal po'ang bcing bar bya'o //
translated: One should bind the kings of bhūtas and vighnas.

original: de nas au dum b'a ra'i yam shing gis me sbar nas bgegs rnams bcing bar bya'o zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de nas au dum b'a ra'i yam shing gis me sbar nas bgegs rnams bcing bar bya'o zhes brjod de /
translated: Then, having ignited a fire with sticks of udumbara wood, one should bind the vighnas.

original: sv'a h'a'i yi ges dkyil 'khor ba rnams la sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: sv'a h'a'i yi ges dkyil 'khor ba rnams la sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra of the maṇḍala deities eight thousand times with the syllable svāhā.

original: der bgegs dang / log par 'dren pa bcings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der bgegs dang / log par 'dren pa bcings par 'gyur ro //
translated: There, the vighnas and the misleaders will be bound.

original: rig pa rnams thams cad sgrub par byed pa na bgegs rnams 'phrul byed do //
analyzed: rig pa rnams thams cad sgrub par byed pa na bgegs rnams 'phrul byed do //
translated: When one is performing all the rites of knowledge, the obstructors create obstacles.

original: des na bgegs dang / log par 'dren pa rnams sa'i snod gcig tu bgegs thams cad gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: des na bgegs dang / log par 'dren pa rnams sa'i snod gcig tu bgegs thams cad gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, all the obstructors and the great misleaders should be placed in one vessel.

original: gcig tu log par 'dren pa chen po'o //
analyzed: gcig tu log par 'dren pa chen po'o //
translated: The great misleaders are in one place.

original: de nas bgegs rnams thams cad la me tog thams cad dbul bar bya zhing log par 'dren pa chen po la tsandan dmar po dang / ka ra b'i ra'i me tog dmar po dbul lo //
analyzed: de nas bgegs rnams thams cad la me tog thams cad dbul bar bya zhing log par 'dren pa chen po la tsandan dmar po dang / ka ra b'i ra'i me tog dmar po dbul lo //
translated: Then, all the flowers should be offered to all the obstructors, and the great misleaders should be offered red sandalwood and red karavīra flowers.

original: bgegs rnams thams cad la rdzas thams cad kyi bdug pa dbul lo //
analyzed: bgegs rnams thams cad la rdzas thams cad kyi bdug pa dbul lo //
translated: All the substances should be offered as incense to all the obstructors.

original: log par 'dren pa chen po la gu gul gyi bdug pa dbul lo //
analyzed: log par 'dren pa chen po la gu gul gyi bdug pa dbul lo //
translated: To the great misleaders, offer incense of bdellium.

original: mar dang bsres pa dbul lo //
analyzed: mar dang bsres pa dbul lo //

original: de nas lte ba'i tshad kyi dong du so sor gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas lte ba'i tshad kyi dong du so sor gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, they should be placed in a pit the size of a navel.

original: de lta bus bgegs thams cad @285b med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bus bgegs thams cad @285b med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, all obstacles will be removed.

original: gso sbyong can gyi dkar po'i bco lnga la ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten dus la ma lhung ba'i ba lang gi lci bas dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs pa byas nas me tog dang / dri dang / bdug pa dang / mar gyi me la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa byas nas au dum b'a ra'i shing gis me sbar nas tshangs ma'i yam shing gi sbyin sreg bya zhing lha la phul ba zos na yid gzhungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gso sbyong can gyi dkar po'i bco lnga la ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten dus la ma lhung ba'i ba lang gi lci bas dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs pa byas nas me tog dang / dri dang / bdug pa dang / mar gyi me la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa byas nas au dum b'a ra'i shing gis me sbar nas tshangs ma'i yam shing gi sbyin sreg bya zhing lha la phul ba zos na yid gzhungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the fifteenth day of the bright fortnight, in a place where there is a caitya containing relics, one should anoint the area with cow dung that has not fallen to the ground. Having made offerings of flowers, incense, perfume, and butter-lamps, one should light a fire with udumbara wood and offer oblations of sticks of the same wood. If one eats the oblations offered to the deity, one will become wise.

original: 'o ma'i sbyin sreg byas na bram ze rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o ma'i sbyin sreg byas na bram ze rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers oblations of milk, the brahmins will be under one’s control.

original: lha la phul ba'i sbyin sreg byas na rgyal rigs dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha la phul ba'i sbyin sreg byas na rgyal rigs dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers oblations of the food offered to the deity, the kṣatriyas will be under one’s control.

original: nas dang / zho dang / lha la phul ba cig tu byas nas sbyin sreg byas na rje rigs dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nas dang / zho dang / lha la phul ba cig tu byas nas sbyin sreg byas na rje rigs dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers oblations of barley, curd, and the food offered to the deity, the vaiśyas will be under one’s control.

original: dag la bltas nas bzlas pa byas na rengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag la bltas nas bzlas pa byas na rengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra while looking at them, they will be paralyzed.

original: lan bdun mngon par sngags pa'i chus thams cad 'bebs pa dang / nor byed do //
analyzed: lan bdun mngon par sngags pa'i chus thams cad 'bebs pa dang / nor byed do //
translated: One should sprinkle all with water incanted seven times.

original: dug thams cad la'ang nye bar byug go /
analyzed: dug thams cad la'ang nye bar byug go /

original: zhun mkhan gyi ril bu byas nas lan bdun mngon par sngags pas mig nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: zhun mkhan gyi ril bu byas nas lan bdun mngon par sngags pas mig nad sel bar byed do //
translated: One should make a pill of the dregs of burnt grain, and with it, incanted seven times, cure eye diseases.

original: na ba la skud pa bcing bar bya ste gdon thams cad mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: na ba la skud pa bcing bar bya ste gdon thams cad mi 'byung ngo //
translated: One should tie a thread around the sick person; all the grahas will not appear.

original: gtsug phud bcings pas bdag nyid srung ba'o //
analyzed: gtsug phud bcings pas bdag nyid srung ba'o //
translated: One should tie up one’s topknot; one will protect oneself.

original: thal bas dkyil 'khor bcing ba'o //
analyzed: thal bas dkyil 'khor bcing ba'o //
translated: One should bind the maṇḍala with ashes.

original: bong ba la lan bdun bzlas pas phyogs bcing ba'o //
analyzed: bong ba la lan bdun bzlas pas phyogs bcing ba'o //
translated: One should bind the directions with clods of earth incanted seven times.

original: bud med bu ma thon pa la til la yongs su bzlas nas sbyin par bya ste bde bar btsa' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med bu ma thon pa la til la yongs su bzlas nas sbyin par bya ste bde bar btsa' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For a woman who is having difficulty giving birth, one should give her sesame seeds incanted [with the mantra]. She will give birth easily.

original: rmongs @286a *// pas mngal gyi zla mtshan gyi dus las 'das pa na khrus bya zhing rgyud mtshungs pa'i 'o ma la brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par sngags pa byas nas btung bar sbyin zhing bza' ba mchog dang / mar bsres pa bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: rmongs @286a *// pas mngal gyi zla mtshan gyi dus las 'das pa na khrus bya zhing rgyud mtshungs pa'i 'o ma la brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par sngags pa byas nas btung bar sbyin zhing bza' ba mchog dang / mar bsres pa bza' bar bya'o //
translated: If, due to delusion, she passes the time of menstruation in the womb, one should give her a bath and have her drink water incanted one hundred and eight times, and give her the best food mixed with ghee.

original: de nas bu btsa' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bu btsa' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the child will be born.

original: bu mang po can gyi sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: bu mang po can gyi sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad bya'o //
translated: One should offer one hundred and eight oblations of the oblation for many children.

original: thal bar chu'i bum pa bzhi dang kun tu bsres nas gzhag par bya'o //🔽shu dag la lan brgyad brgyar bzlas te lag pa g-yas pa la bcings pas ji srid smra ba thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thal bar chu'i bum pa bzhi dang kun tu bsres nas gzhag par bya'o // shu dag la lan brgyad brgyar bzlas te lag pa g-yas pa la bcings pas ji srid smra ba thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: One should mix the ashes with water in a vase and place it everywhere.🔽One should incant white mustard seeds one hundred and eight times and tie them on the right arm; one will become the best of all speakers.

original: gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i me tog gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na g-yul du gzhan gyis mi thub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i me tog gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na g-yul du gzhan gyis mi thub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of invincible flowers, one will become invincible in battle.
