original: gzhon nu mas bkal ba'i skud pa la mdud pa byas te lan bdun mngon par sngags nas lag pa bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu mas bkal ba'i skud pa la mdud pa byas te lan bdun mngon par sngags nas lag pa bcing bar bya'o //
translated: One should tie a knot in the thread spun by a young girl, incant it seven times, and tie it on one’s arm.

original: brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i dug mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i dug mi 'byung ngo //
translated: One will be protected from the poison of all crawling creatures.

original: de nas ma rungs pas mche ba'i ming nas smos te chu la lan bdun mngon par sngags nas khyor chu 'thungs bas de lta bus shi ba'ang ldang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas ma rungs pas mche ba'i ming nas smos te chu la lan bdun mngon par sngags nas khyor chu 'thungs bas de lta bus shi ba'ang ldang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, one should incant water seven times with the name of the wicked one and make him drink it. In this way, even one who is dead will rise up.

original: de bzhin du bcu bzhi ru mngon par sngags par byas nas btung ba dsbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcu bzhi ru mngon par sngags par byas nas btung ba dsbyin par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should incant fourteen times and give him a drink.

original: 'jog pos kyang mche ba sos par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jog pos kyang mche ba sos par bya'o //
translated: The one who is possessed should also show his fangs.

original: chang gi phabs la lan bdun mngon par sngags pa byas nas shi ba la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: chang gi phabs la lan bdun mngon par sngags pa byas nas shi ba la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: One should incant seven times the yeast for beer and give it to the one who is dead.

original: gal te byis pa mi 'byung @286b ngo; ;de nas sems dpa' chen pos slar yang rig pa thams cad yang dag par skul bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas sgrub pa'i thabs kyi spyi'i rig pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te byis pa mi 'byung @286b ngo; ;de nas sems dpa' chen pos slar yang rig pa thams cad yang dag par skul bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas sgrub pa'i thabs kyi spyi'i rig pa gsungs so //
translated: If the child does not come out, then the great being should again enter the samadhi called “the knowledge that perfectly incites all the vidyas,” and he should recite the general knowledge of the means of accomplishment.

original: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
analyzed: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /

original: ta th'a ga t'a ya /
analyzed: ta th'a ga t'a ya /

original: aarha te / samyaksam buddha ya /
analyzed: aarha te / samyaksam buddha ya /

original: na ma a'arya aa ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
analyzed: na ma a'arya aa ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /

original: bo dhi satv'a ya /
analyzed: bo dhi satv'a ya /

original: mah'a satv'a ya; ri dzu ke /
analyzed: mah'a satv'a ya; ri dzu ke /

original: t'a re / sh'ante /
analyzed: t'a re / sh'ante /

original: tutt'a re / aa na bhi /
analyzed: tutt'a re / aa na bhi /

original: s'a le / tu re sv'ah'a /
analyzed: s'a le / tu re sv'ah'a /

original: 'di ni 'phags ma sgol ma spyi bo'i sgrol ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags ma sgol ma spyi bo'i sgrol ma zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the “head-Tara” of the noble Tara.

original: rig pa 'dis rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu klung du phrag pa'i tshad kyis chur zhugs nas rig pa stong phrag brgya bzlas par bya ste ji srid nam mkha' nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la bug pa mthong ba'i bar du ste de lta bu byas pas las 'grub par 'gyur
analyzed: rig pa 'dis rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu klung du phrag pa'i tshad kyis chur zhugs nas rig pa stong phrag brgya bzlas par bya ste ji srid nam mkha' nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la bug pa mthong ba'i bar du ste de lta bu byas pas las 'grub par 'gyur
translated: With this knowledge, one should enter into the water of a river that flows into the ocean up to one’s armpits and recite the knowledge-mantra one hundred thousand times until one sees a hole in the sky in the orb of the sun.

original: ro // gal te ma mthong na slar yang bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: ro // gal te ma mthong na slar yang bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: If one does not see it, one should practice again.

original: de nas lan bdun du mar rjes su song nas dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dang / gtor ma'i cho ga bya ste lag pa g-yas pas mnan nas mtshan thog thag tu bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas lan bdun du mar rjes su song nas dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dang / gtor ma'i cho ga bya ste lag pa g-yas pas mnan nas mtshan thog thag tu bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, having gone seven times in succession, one should perform the rite with perfume, flowers, incense, and a bali offering, and pressing down with one’s right hand, one should recite the mantra throughout the night.

original: ji srid dbugs 'byin no zhes brjod pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid dbugs 'byin no zhes brjod pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Until one says, “I will give you relief.”

original: nyi ma so sor dngul brgya sbyin par byed de de'ang zad par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma so sor dngul brgya sbyin par byed de de'ang zad par bya'o //
translated: Every day one should give one hundred silver coins, and that should be used up.

original: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
analyzed: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /

analyzed: na mo aa mi t'a bh'a ya /

analyzed: ta th'a ga t'a ya /

analyzed: aarha te / samyaksam buddha ya /
translated: the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

analyzed: na ma a'arya aa ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /

translated: This is the purification of Noble Tārā.

original: rig pa 'dis dgon pa'i ba lang gi lci ba zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'dis dgon pa'i ba lang gi lci ba zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: With this knowledge, one should perform eight thousand oblations of cow dung from a wild cow mixed with curd, honey, and ghee.

original: dus gsum du ba lang brgya rnyed do //
analyzed: dus gsum du ba lang brgya rnyed do //
translated: One will obtain a hundred cows in three months.

original: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
analyzed: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /

original: na ma a'arya aa ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
analyzed: na ma a'arya aa ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /

analyzed: bo dhi satv'a ya / mah'a satv'a ya /

analyzed: mah'a k'a ru ni k'a ya /

original: lambe / pra lambe /
analyzed: lambe / pra lambe /

original: lambe b'irya / sarba siddhi mme ku ru sv'ah'a /
analyzed: lambe b'irya / sarba siddhi mme ku ru sv'ah'a /
translated: LAMBE VĪRYE SARVASIDDHI MAME KURU SVĀHĀ

original: 'di ni 'phags ma sgrol ma 'phyang ba zhes bya ba ste rig pa 'dis ka ra b'i ra'i yam shing la mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste ji srid rgyal po dbang du 'gyur te 'ong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags ma sgrol ma 'phyang ba zhes bya ba ste rig pa 'dis ka ra b'i ra'i yam shing la mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste ji srid rgyal po dbang du 'gyur te 'ong bar byed do //
translated: This is the noble Tārā called “Hanging,” and by this knowledge, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of karavīra sticks smeared with ghee, and the king will come under one’s control.

original: sde snod smra ba'ang bsgo ba'i las byas pa 'ching ba grol ba la sogs pa de'ang sbyong du 'jug go /
analyzed: sde snod smra ba'ang bsgo ba'i las byas pa 'ching ba grol ba la sogs pa de'ang sbyong du 'jug go /
translated: One should also make the one who is bound perform the rite of liberation, and so on.

original: de ma grol bar du mang du dngos grub thams cad kyis grub pa yang sngar brjod pa'i rigs pas /
analyzed: de ma grol bar du mang du dngos grub thams cad kyis grub pa yang sngar brjod pa'i rigs pas /
translated: Until he is liberated, one should not give him any of the accomplishments, as explained previously.🔽One should give him the mantra “Sarvasiddhinica!

original: sarba siddhinytsa / me ku ru sv'ah'a zhes byin nas rtag tu bzlas pas 'ching ba grol bar byed do //
analyzed: sarba siddhinytsa / me ku ru sv'ah'a zhes byin nas rtag tu bzlas pas 'ching ba grol bar byed do //
translated: Mekuru svāhā!” and have him always recite it.

original: yang na gtsang mar gyur pas mtshan thog thag bzlas par bya ste 'ching ba grol bar byed do //
analyzed: yang na gtsang mar gyur pas mtshan thog thag bzlas par bya ste 'ching ba grol bar byed do //
translated: Or else, one should have him recite it throughout the night in a clean place.

original: 'di ni 'phags ma sgrol mo zhi ba zhes bya ba'i rig pa ste 'dis ma du lum ga dang / dh'a lan dang / sog ma'i me la sbyin sreg bya ste ji srid log 'dren 'ong bar byed de de brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags ma sgrol mo zhi ba zhes bya ba'i rig pa ste 'dis ma du lum ga dang / dh'a lan dang / sog ma'i me la sbyin sreg bya ste ji srid log 'dren 'ong bar byed de de brjod par bya'o //
translated: This is the knowledge called The Pacification of Noble Tārā. With this, one should perform a homa with madūlaka, dhālan, and straw fire, until the guide of the dead comes. He should be addressed:🔽Give me a penny every day.

original: nyi ma so sor bdag la dong tse re sbin mo; ;de'ang zad par bya'o //

translated: Let me touch the Blessed One's feet.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na mi sdod do //🔽na mo ratna tra y'a ya /

translated: Otherwise, he will not stay.🔽Namo ratnatrayāya.

original: 'di ni 'phags ma sgrol ma drang por ldan ma zhes bya ba'i rig pa ste rtag tu bzlas pas drang po'i sems bskyed par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags ma sgrol ma drang por ldan ma zhes bya ba'i rig pa ste rtag tu bzlas pas drang po'i sems bskyed par byed do //
translated: This is the knowledge called “Noble Tārā with Uprightness,” which, if always recited, will give rise to an upright mind.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba'i rig pa 'di rnams bklags pas 'grub pa bdag nyid srung ba dang / gzhan srung ba dang / bde ba thams cad sbyin pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba'i rig pa 'di rnams bklags pas 'grub pa bdag nyid srung ba dang / gzhan srung ba dang / bde ba thams cad sbyin pa /
translated: By reciting these knowledge mantras called “All Dharmas,” one will accomplish the protection of oneself, the protection of others, and the bestowal of all happiness.

original: 'bum phrag gcig brjod pas sngar brjod pa'i las thams cad bsgrub par bya ste stong phrag bcu bzlas pas bsod nams 'phel bar byed pa /
analyzed: 'bum phrag gcig brjod pas sngar brjod pa'i las thams cad bsgrub par bya ste stong phrag bcu bzlas pas bsod nams 'phel bar byed pa /
translated: By reciting ten thousand times, one will increase one’s merit.

original: stong phrag sum cu bzlas pas bsod nams dang ldan pa /
analyzed: stong phrag sum cu bzlas pas bsod nams dang ldan pa /
translated: By reciting thirty thousand times, one will be endowed with merit.

original: 'bum phrag gsum bzlas nas mtshams med pa byas pas kyang 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bum phrag gsum bzlas nas mtshams med pa byas pas kyang 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: By reciting three hundred thousand times, even one who has committed the crimes with immediate retribution will be successful.

original: mdor na / ma nor bar phan pa sgrub pa'i sems sbyin pa snying rje'i bdag nyid can yang rtag tu bzlas pas nad thams cad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdor na / ma nor bar phan pa sgrub pa'i sems sbyin pa snying rje'i bdag nyid can yang rtag tu bzlas pas nad thams cad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In brief, by reciting the mantra of the essence of compassion, which is the mind that accomplishes benefit without error, all diseases will be eliminated.

original: yams thams cad mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yams thams cad mi 'byung ngo //
translated: All epidemics will not occur.🔽All harms will not arise.

original: nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes de bzhin du rtogs @290a *//
analyzed: nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes de bzhin du rtogs @290a *//
translated: One should understand it in this way.

original: par bya'o // de nas 'di'i cho ga phyogs tsam du 'gyur te 'bum bzlas pas las thams cad kyis mi chugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par bya'o // de nas 'di'i cho ga phyogs tsam du 'gyur te 'bum bzlas pas las thams cad kyis mi chugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, this will be a mere fraction of its ritual: By reciting one hundred thousand times, one will be invincible to all activities.

original: 'bum phrag gnyis bzlas pas sdig pa zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bum phrag gnyis bzlas pas sdig pa zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting two hundred thousand times, one’s evil will be exhausted.

original: 'bum phrag gsum bzlas pas mchog rnams sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'bum phrag gsum bzlas pas mchog rnams sgrub par byed do //
translated: By reciting it three hundred thousand times, one will accomplish the supreme.🔽By reciting it four hundred thousand times, one will attain the individual superknowledges.

original: 'bum phrag bzhi bzlas pas mngon par shes pa so sor rnyed do; ;'bum phrag lnga bzlas pas lha'i shes pa so sor rnyed do //
analyzed: 'bum phrag bzhi bzlas pas mngon par shes pa so sor rnyed do; ;'bum phrag lnga bzlas pas lha'i shes pa so sor rnyed do //
translated: By reciting it five hundred thousand times, one will attain the divine knowledge.

original: 'bum phrag drug bzlas pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che rnyed do //
analyzed: 'bum phrag drug bzlas pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che rnyed do //
translated: By reciting it six hundred thousand times, one will obtain the wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: 'bum phrag bdun bzlas pas mngon par shes pa lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bum phrag bdun bzlas pas mngon par shes pa lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting it seven hundred thousand times, one will attain the five superknowledges.

original: 'bum phrag bcu bzlas pas rgyal srid chen po so sor rnyed do //
analyzed: 'bum phrag bcu bzlas pas rgyal srid chen po so sor rnyed do //
translated: By reciting it ten hundred thousand times, one will attain a great kingdom.

original: 'bum phrag bcu gcig bzlas pas rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bum phrag bcu gcig bzlas pas rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting it eleven hundred thousand times, one will become a vidyādhara.

original: de nas mig sman ldong ros aa shvat+tha'i 'dab ma bdun gyi nang du btums te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar ji srid dro ba dang / du ba 'thul ba dang / 'bar ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mig sman ldong ros aa shvat+tha'i 'dab ma bdun gyi nang du btums te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar ji srid dro ba dang / du ba 'thul ba dang / 'bar ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should wrap the collyrium in the seven leaves of the aśvattha tree and recite the mantra in front of the Blessed One until it smokes, burns, and blazes.

original: de la dro bar gyur pas ni dbang du byed do //
analyzed: de la dro bar gyur pas ni dbang du byed do //
translated: By the heat, one will enthrall.

original: du ba 'thul bas ni mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: du ba 'thul bas ni mi snang ba'o //
translated: By the smoke, one will become invisible.

original: 'bar bas ni nam mkha' la 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'bar bas ni nam mkha' la 'gro'o //
translated: By igniting, one will fly through the sky.

original: mar gyi sreg blugs 'bum sbyin sreg byas na gang 'dod pa de sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: mar gyi sreg blugs 'bum sbyin sreg byas na gang 'dod pa de sbyin par byed do //
translated: If one offers one hundred thousand oblations of clarified butter, one will obtain whatever one desires.

original: 'bum phrag bcu gsum bzlas par bya ste 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'bum phrag bcu gsum bzlas par bya ste 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug mthong ngo //
translated: One should recite [the mantra] one hundred thousand times. One will see Noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: de mthong nas gang tshol ba de rnyed do //
analyzed: de mthong nas gang tshol ba de rnyed do //
translated: Having seen him, one will obtain whatever one seeks.

original: tsandan dkar po'i @290b yam shing gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: tsandan dkar po'i @290b yam shing gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: One should offer eight thousand oblations of white sandalwood sticks.

original: tshig gam / zhabs 'ching ba thob cing yul gyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig gam / zhabs 'ching ba thob cing yul gyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
translated: One will obtain a position, a foot-ornament, and become a lord of the land.

original: aa ga ru nag po'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg 'bum bya'o //
analyzed: aa ga ru nag po'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg 'bum bya'o //
translated: One should offer one hundred thousand oblations of black aloe wood sticks.

original: rgyal po dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po dbang du 'gyur ro //

original: rgya chen po rnyed do //
analyzed: rgya chen po rnyed do //
translated: One will obtain a great deal.

original: tsandan dmar po'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg 'bum bya'o //
analyzed: tsandan dmar po'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg 'bum bya'o //
translated: One should offer one hundred thousand oblations of red sandalwood sticks.

original: grub pa thams cad la stong phrag bsdus pa rnyed do //
analyzed: grub pa thams cad la stong phrag bsdus pa rnyed do //
translated: One will obtain a thousandfold collection of all accomplishments.

original: byang chub shing gi 'og tu 'bum phrag bdun bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub shing gi 'og tu 'bum phrag bdun bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Under a bodhi tree, one should recite [the mantra] seven hundred thousand times.

original: bcud dang / bcud kyis len rnams rnyed do //
analyzed: bcud dang / bcud kyis len rnams rnyed do //
translated: One will obtain the elixir of life and the elixir of immortality.

original: zos pas skra dkar dang / gnyer ma spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zos pas skra dkar dang / gnyer ma spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By eating it, one will get rid of gray hair and wrinkles.

original: rtag tu bzlas pas bya rgod sel bar byed do //
analyzed: rtag tu bzlas pas bya rgod sel bar byed do //
translated: By constantly reciting it, one will remove the vulture [mark].

original: 'bum phrag gnyis bzlas pas rgyal po'i btsun mo mchog dang rnam par 'phrul bar byed do //
analyzed: 'bum phrag gnyis bzlas pas rgyal po'i btsun mo mchog dang rnam par 'phrul bar byed do //
translated: By reciting it two hundred thousand times, one will enthrall the king’s chief queen.

original: yungs kar rgyal pos rtag tu sbyin sreg byas na rgyal po dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yungs kar rgyal pos rtag tu sbyin sreg byas na rgyal po dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: By constantly offering oblations of mustard seed, one will enthrall the king.

original: 'di la mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Here one should offer oblations of ghee.

original: rtag tu nor rnyed do //
analyzed: rtag tu nor rnyed do //

original: gso sbyong can gyis 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong can gyis 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One who is fasting should recite it one hundred thousand times.

original: bza' ba dang / btung ba zhim po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bza' ba dang / btung ba zhim po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Delicious food and drink will appear.

original: aarga'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg 'bum bya'o //
analyzed: aarga'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg 'bum bya'o //
translated: One should offer one hundred thousand oblations of argha wood.

original: gser brgya rnyed do //
analyzed: gser brgya rnyed do //
translated: One will obtain one hundred measures of gold.

original: pi n+ya kam gi sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: pi n+ya kam gi sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should offer oblations of piṇyāka.

original: skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be loved by all people.

original: yid la byas nas bzlas pa bya ste rtag tu bzlas pas nad thams cad dang / gdon thams cad dang / gdung ba thams cad dang / nye bar 'tshe ba dang / 'jigs pa thams cad 'joms par byed do //🔽gu gul gyi ril bu la ma @291a *//
analyzed: yid la byas nas bzlas pa bya ste rtag tu bzlas pas nad thams cad dang / gdon thams cad dang / gdung ba thams cad dang / nye bar 'tshe ba dang / 'jigs pa thams cad 'joms par byed do // gu gul gyi ril bu la ma @291a *//
translated: Having done this, one should recite the mantra. By always reciting it, one will destroy all diseases, all evil spirits, all torments, all harms, and all fears.

original: gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: One should offer into the fire one thousand and eight pills of guggula smeared with ghee.

original: nor 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: 'bum phrag gsum gyis rgyal srid rnyed do //
analyzed: 'bum phrag gsum gyis rgyal srid rnyed do //
translated: By offering three hundred thousand [pills], one will obtain a kingdom.

original: rgyu skar gyis gnod pa la 'o ma dang phan tshun bsres pa'i zho'i sbyin sreg bya sta zhi par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu skar gyis gnod pa la 'o ma dang phan tshun bsres pa'i zho'i sbyin sreg bya sta zhi par 'gyur ro //
translated: For harm caused by the lunar asterisms, one should offer into the fire curd mixed with milk. [The harm] will be pacified.

original: bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: bdag nyid dam /

original: gzhan gyis sna ma'i me tog gis sbyin sreg gis rgyal po dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis sna ma'i me tog gis sbyin sreg gis rgyal po dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: another, one should offer jasmine flowers into the fire. One will bring the king under one's control.

original: d'ur ba'i myu gus sbyin sreg bya ste zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: d'ur ba'i myu gus sbyin sreg bya ste zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should offer durva sprouts into the fire. [The king] will be pacified.

original: bdag dang / gzhan gyi rgyas par 'dod na til dang / 'bras thug po che'i sbyin sreg bya ste nor chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dang / gzhan gyi rgyas par 'dod na til dang / 'bras thug po che'i sbyin sreg bya ste nor chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one desires prosperity for oneself or others, one should perform a homa with sesame seeds and rice; one will obtain great wealth.

original: b'a la dang / so so la ka la brgyad brgyar mngon bar sngags pa byas nas 'byung po'i nye bar 'tshe bas btab pa'i sems can thams cad la ston du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: b'a la dang / so so la ka la brgyad brgyar mngon bar sngags pa byas nas 'byung po'i nye bar 'tshe bas btab pa'i sems can thams cad la ston du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should incant bālaka eight hundred times and have all beings afflicted by bhūta grahas smell it.

original: mthong ba la rab gnas 'gro'o //
analyzed: mthong ba la rab gnas 'gro'o //
translated: They will be freed from the grahas.

original: mig la brgyad brgyar bzlas na dang po gang mthong bde dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la brgyad brgyar bzlas na dang po gang mthong bde dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If one incants one’s eyes eight hundred times, whoever one looks at first will become enthralled.

original: chu la yongs su bzlas nas gdong bkru bar bya ste skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu la yongs su bzlas nas gdong bkru bar bya ste skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one incants water and washes one’s face, all people will be pleased.

original: bya rog ma 'phur ba la rtag tu bzlas pas gang 'dod pa de rnyed do //
analyzed: bya rog ma 'phur ba la rtag tu bzlas pas gang 'dod pa de rnyed do //
translated: If one always recites the mantra over a crow that is not flying, one will obtain whatever one desires.

original: chu la lan bdun mngon par sngags pa'i khyor chu nyi ma so sor tho rangs btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu la lan bdun mngon par sngags pa'i khyor chu nyi ma so sor tho rangs btung bar bya'o //
translated: One should drink every day at dawn water incanted seven times;

original: nad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will be free from disease.

original: de nas bud med dbang du bya bar 'dod pas lan tshva las byas pa'i gzugs brnyan byas nas rkang pa g-yon pas mnan te spyi bor stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya ste nyi ma bdun gyi @291b dbang du 'gyur ro zhes pa sgrub thabs kyi grub pa dang
analyzed: de nas bud med dbang du bya bar 'dod pas lan tshva las byas pa'i gzugs brnyan byas nas rkang pa g-yon pas mnan te spyi bor stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya ste nyi ma bdun gyi @291b dbang du 'gyur ro zhes pa sgrub thabs kyi grub pa dang
translated: Then, one who wishes to bring a woman under one’s power should make an effigy out of salt, step on it with one’s left foot, and recite [the mantra] eight thousand times over her head. She will be under one’s power for seven days.

original: / yid la grub pa'i don thams cad sgrub pa 'di rnams sad pa'i rgyur yang rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: / yid la grub pa'i don thams cad sgrub pa 'di rnams sad pa'i rgyur yang rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: These accomplishments of the means of achievement and the accomplishment of all aims in the mind should also be applied as the cause of awakening.

original: de bzhin du'ang 'dir phyogs cung zad tsam zhig byas pa las sgrub thabs kyis nye bar sbyor ba'i khyad par gyi stobs su 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du'ang 'dir phyogs cung zad tsam zhig byas pa las sgrub thabs kyis nye bar sbyor ba'i khyad par gyi stobs su 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: And so, here a mere fraction of the direction [is given], but the power of the application of the means of achievement should be made.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs tsam gyis //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs tsam gyis //
translated: By the mere melody of the verse,

original: sgrub pa'i yang dag dngos grub spyod //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i yang dag dngos grub spyod //
translated: the true accomplishment of the means of achievement is practiced.

original: shin tu stong min gang ba min //
analyzed: shin tu stong min gang ba min //
translated: Not too empty, not too full,

original: bza' ba kun nas sbyin par bya //
analyzed: bza' ba kun nas sbyin par bya //

original: tsha ba mngar skyur la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: tsha ba mngar skyur la sogs pa'i //
translated: From the tastes of hot, sweet, sour, and so on,

original: ro las yul bral lnga la yang //
analyzed: ro las yul bral lnga la yang //
translated: even in the five sense objects free from attachment,

original: sred pa ldan pas ro la ni //
analyzed: sred pa ldan pas ro la ni //
translated: One who is attached to taste

original: sred pa gang phyir skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sred pa gang phyir skye bar 'gyur //
translated: will be born again because of craving.🔽One should not undertake even a little

original: sred pas bzlas dang sbyin sreg sogs //🔽'dir ni cung zad brtsam mi bya //
analyzed: sred pas bzlas dang sbyin sreg sogs // 'dir ni cung zad brtsam mi bya //
translated: recitation, fire sacrifice, and so forth out of craving.

original: 'dir spro 'dir ni rnam par shes //
analyzed: 'dir spro 'dir ni rnam par shes //
translated: Here one should be enthusiastic, here one should be conscious,

original: lag pa ldag la sogs brjod pa //
analyzed: lag pa ldag la sogs brjod pa //
translated: but one should not speak of licking one's hands, and so forth.

original: dor bar bya 'am dor bya min //
analyzed: dor bar bya 'am dor bya min //
translated: One should not abandon what should not be abandoned,🔽but one should abandon what should be abandoned.

original: nang du g-yog po lha rnams ni //
analyzed: nang du g-yog po lha rnams ni //
translated: The gods who are one's servants

original: phur bu gnas par yongs brtag bya //
analyzed: phur bu gnas par yongs brtag bya //
translated: should be thoroughly examined in their abode.

original: lha rnams kyi ni khang pa 'am //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi ni khang pa 'am //
translated: In the temple of the gods,

original: khang stong dang ni phug gi nang //
analyzed: khang stong dang ni phug gi nang //
translated: in an empty house or a cave,🔽under a solitary tree or in a charnel ground,

original: shing gcig gam ni dur khrod dang // ri bo dang ni tshang tshing du //
analyzed: shing gcig gam ni dur khrod dang // ri bo dang ni tshang tshing du //
translated: on a mountain or in a thicket,

original: bzlas dang sbyin sreg sgrub pa yang //
analyzed: bzlas dang sbyin sreg sgrub pa yang //
translated: one should perform recitation, fire sacrifice, and practice

original: rtse gcig yid kyis bya ba yin //
analyzed: rtse gcig yid kyis bya ba yin //

original: ma dag ma dag kun dag la //
analyzed: ma dag ma dag kun dag la //
translated: In the impure, the impure and pure, and the completely pure,

original: dag pa rnam par sbyong ba yin //
analyzed: dag pa rnam par sbyong ba yin //

original: gnyis ka yis kyang gnyis ka la //
analyzed: gnyis ka yis kyang gnyis ka la //

original: dngos grub smra bas bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: dngos grub smra bas bsgrub par bya //

original: gang yang ro yi srad bu dang // lhag ma de nas 'gongs pa dang // zla mtshan ldan pas kun tu reg /
analyzed: gang yang ro yi srad bu dang // lhag ma de nas 'gongs pa dang // zla mtshan ldan pas kun tu reg /
translated: “A thread of flesh, or if it is more than that, or if it is touched by a menstruating woman,

original: gdol pa'i skye bos @292a *//🔽bskol ba yang //
analyzed: gdol pa'i skye bos @292a *// bskol ba yang //
translated: or if it is boiled by a caṇḍāla,

original: rul pa'i dri dang slar yang 'byung //
analyzed: rul pa'i dri dang slar yang 'byung //
translated: the smell of rotten flesh will arise again.

original: legs byas 'dod pas sbyin par bya //
analyzed: legs byas 'dod pas sbyin par bya //
translated: “One should give it to those who desire well-cooked food.

original: lha rnams ched du bsnyen pa las //
analyzed: lha rnams ched du bsnyen pa las //
translated: For the sake of the gods,🔽one should offer it to those who have qualities such as these:

original: de lta la sogs yon tan ldan; ;zas sam mal stan la sogs pa //🔽sgrub pa rang gis blangs pa 'am //
analyzed: de lta la sogs yon tan ldan; ;zas sam mal stan la sogs pa // sgrub pa rang gis blangs pa 'am //
translated: food, bedding, and so forth.🔽“One should not accept it oneself,

original: min pa nyid ni bsnyen par bya //
analyzed: min pa nyid ni bsnyen par bya //
translated: but rather offer it to those who are worthy.

original: btung ba ldan pas gnas dang dga'//
analyzed: btung ba ldan pas gnas dang dga'//
translated: One should offer it to those who are endowed with drink,🔽who have a mind that is free from evil beings,

original: skye bo ngan pa'i sems can bcas; ;phyi ru kun tu btags pas blangs //
analyzed: skye bo ngan pa'i sems can bcas; ;phyi ru kun tu btags pas blangs //
translated: and who have taken it externally by means of the binding.

original: mtshams med lnga po byed pa po //
analyzed: mtshams med lnga po byed pa po //
translated: “One should not offer it to those who have committed the five acts of immediate retribution,

original: nad dang 'byung chen byed pa dang // med pa 'am yang mngan yang //
analyzed: nad dang 'byung chen byed pa dang // med pa 'am yang mngan yang //
translated: to those who are afflicted by disease, to those who are great, to those who are not, or to those who are.🔽“One should not offer it to those who are destroyed by food and laziness,

original: zas dang le los bcom pa dang // dge 'dun 'khu dang ngo tsha med //
analyzed: zas dang le los bcom pa dang // dge 'dun 'khu dang ngo tsha med //
translated: to those who are hostile to the saṅgha, to those who are shameless,

original: ser sna lhur len tshon gyis 'bugs //
analyzed: ser sna lhur len tshon gyis 'bugs //
translated: to those who are intent on stinginess, or to those who are pierced by the colors.

original: rtag tu log par lta ba gzhan //
analyzed: rtag tu log par lta ba gzhan //

original: de la sogs pa'i yon tan ldan //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i yon tan ldan //

original: kun tu gsungs pa mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu gsungs pa mdzes pa'o //
translated: He is said to be beautiful.

original: dus min khrus ni mi nus na'ang //
analyzed: dus min khrus ni mi nus na'ang //
translated: If one is unable to bathe at the wrong time,

original: rang gis nus pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: rang gis nus pa ma yin pa //
translated: One should not do it oneself.

original: rang gi rlung ni mchog tu bsgrags //
analyzed: rang gi rlung ni mchog tu bsgrags //
translated: One's own wind is proclaimed supreme.

original: dus gsum min par de yod pa //🔽cig tu theg gsum bral ba dang // khrus nyes pa dang chu bo'i nang //
analyzed: dus gsum min par de yod pa // cig tu theg gsum bral ba dang // khrus nyes pa dang chu bo'i nang //
translated: Not being in the three times, it exists.🔽In one place, free from the three vehicles,

original: nyes pa gsum zhes bya ba 'joms //
analyzed: nyes pa gsum zhes bya ba 'joms //
translated: The three faults of bathing and in the river,🔽Are said to be overcome.

original: khrus ni mchog tu rab tu bsgrags //
analyzed: khrus ni mchog tu rab tu bsgrags //
translated: Bathing is proclaimed to be supreme.

original: de phyir dus kyang kun bsams nas //
analyzed: de phyir dus kyang kun bsams nas //

original: me des sam ni de nas kyang //🔽chu yis khrus ni dngos grub kun //
analyzed: me des sam ni de nas kyang // chu yis khrus ni dngos grub kun //
translated: By that fire or from that,🔽Bathing with water is taught to the practitioner

original: sgrub pa po la bstan pa yin //
analyzed: sgrub pa po la bstan pa yin //
translated: For the sake of all accomplishments.

original: de nas kun tu nad pa las //
analyzed: de nas kun tu nad pa las //

original: gsang ba'i sngags kyis khrus rnams ni //
analyzed: gsang ba'i sngags kyis khrus rnams ni //

original: rab tu bsgrags bar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: rab tu bsgrags bar 'gyur ba yin //

original: yang @292b 'dir sngags ni /🔽na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
analyzed: yang @292b 'dir sngags ni / na mo ratna tra y'a ya /

original: na mo aa mi t'a bh'a ya /
analyzed: na mo aa mi t'a bh'a ya /

original: ta th'a ga t'a ya /
analyzed: ta th'a ga t'a ya /

original: aarha te / samyaksam buddha ya /
analyzed: aarha te / samyaksam buddha ya /

original: buddha shu tsi /
analyzed: buddha shu tsi /

original: dharma shu tsi /
analyzed: dharma shu tsi /

original: sam gha shu tsi /
analyzed: sam gha shu tsi /

original: aa ne na parya /
analyzed: aa ne na parya /

original: b'a kye na /
analyzed: b'a kye na /

original: aa shu tsi shu tsi ra; bha b'a mi sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aa shu tsi shu tsi ra; bha b'a mi sv'a h'a /

original: sngags 'dis chu la lan gcig yongs su bzlas nas bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngags 'dis chu la lan gcig yongs su bzlas nas bkru bar bya'o //
translated: With this mantra, having recited it once, one should wash.

original: sngon du bsnyen pa dang / sgrub pa'i dus su dang / nad pa la sngags 'dis khrus byas pas gtsang mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa dang / sgrub pa'i dus su dang / nad pa la sngags 'dis khrus byas pas gtsang mar 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of preliminary practice and practice, and when bathing a patient, by this mantra one becomes pure.

original: mtshan mo'i stod du thun gsum du dam pa'i chos kyi kha ton la sogs pa rnams kyis dub pas mtshan mo'i gung la ku sha la sogs pa'i stan la gtsang sbra dang / srung ba'i cho ga dang / phyag rgyas yongs su brtags te bsgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo'i stod du thun gsum du dam pa'i chos kyi kha ton la sogs pa rnams kyis dub pas mtshan mo'i gung la ku sha la sogs pa'i stan la gtsang sbra dang / srung ba'i cho ga dang / phyag rgyas yongs su brtags te bsgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga bya'o //
translated: In the first part of the night, having become tired from reciting the holy Dharma and so forth three times, in the middle of the night, on a seat of kuśa grass and so forth, with purity, protection rites, and seals, one should perform the method of practice.

original: de'i tshe srung ba byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe srung ba byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, one becomes protected.

original: seng ge'i mal du sgrub pa pos rtag tu seng ge'i stabs kyi lho 'am; shar gyi phyogs su mgo bo bstan nas rmi lam du me zhi ba can nam /
analyzed: seng ge'i mal du sgrub pa pos rtag tu seng ge'i stabs kyi lho 'am; shar gyi phyogs su mgo bo bstan nas rmi lam du me zhi ba can nam /
translated: The practitioner should always sleep in the lion's posture, with his head pointing south or east.

original: rgyas ba can gyi sbyin sreg gal te gyur na shar dang / lho'i lho ru kun tu gnas nas rkang pa rab tu brkyang bar bya'o; ;nub kyi phyogs su mgo bo byas nas lho'i phyogs su kha bltas la nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas ba can gyi sbyin sreg gal te gyur na shar dang / lho'i lho ru kun tu gnas nas rkang pa rab tu brkyang bar bya'o; ;nub kyi phyogs su mgo bo byas nas lho'i phyogs su kha bltas la nyal bar bya'o //
translated: If he dreams of a fire that is either pacified or expanding, he should sleep with his head pointing east or south, and extend his feet in the southern direction.

original: rig pa rnams dang yang dag par ldan pas gang yang tsandan dang / bil ba la sogs pa dang / n+ya gro dha dang / au dum b'a ra la sogs pa rmi lam du mthong na bdag nyid yang dag par 'phags pa'i dngos grub kyi mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: rig pa rnams dang yang dag par ldan pas gang yang tsandan dang / bil ba la sogs pa dang / n+ya gro dha dang / au dum b'a ra la sogs pa rmi lam du mthong na bdag nyid yang dag par 'phags pa'i dngos grub kyi mtshan ma'o //
translated: If he dreams of sandalwood, bilva, and so forth, or of nyagrodha, udumbara, and so forth, in conjunction with the knowledge mantras, this is a sign of the accomplishment of the exalted state.

original: ngang pa dang / bya k'a randa pa dang / khrung khrung dang / rma @293a *//
analyzed: ngang pa dang / bya k'a randa pa dang / khrung khrung dang / rma @293a *//
translated: If he dreams of geese, karandavas, cranes, and peacocks,

translated: If one sees oneself wearing white garments, one’s life will be extended. There is no doubt that accomplishment will come about.🔽If one sees oneself ascending a palace, or if one sees a banner, or if one sees a garland of banners, or if one ascends a ship, or if one sees a lute, or if one sees a dog, or if one sees oneself smeared with oil, or if one sees oneself smeared with sesame oil, this is a sign of accomplishment.

translated: This is the opposite of killing all living beings, of always stealing the property of others, of sexual misconduct, of always drinking intoxicants, of causing people to fight with each other, of wearing garlands,🔽colors, perfumes, ornaments, high beds, and so on, and of the eight worldly concerns.

original: kha dog dang / gar gyi don dang / rol pa dang / dregs pa dang / mal stan chen po dang / mthon po can las log ste gang da lta dgra bcom pa yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kha dog dang / gar gyi don dang / rol pa dang / dregs pa dang / mal stan chen po dang / mthon po can las log ste gang da lta dgra bcom pa yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the opposite of the eight worldly concerns, and it is the present practice of the eight-branched poṣadha of the arhats.

original: bsdu bar bya'o zhes @295b brjod par bya ba yod pa bsam pas sems can thams cad kyi don du'ang mgron du gnyer bar bya'o zhes brjod nas byang chub kyi sems kyis bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsdu bar bya'o zhes @295b brjod par bya ba yod pa bsam pas sems can thams cad kyi don du'ang mgron du gnyer bar bya'o zhes brjod nas byang chub kyi sems kyis bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Having said, “I will gather them,” one should invite all sentient beings to the feast, thinking, “I will gather them with the thought of awakening.”

original: rtag tu dkon mchog gi rang bzhin gyi skyabs 'gro sngon du 'gro bas yang dag par bskyed nas sgrub pa pos rim pa 'dis thams cad mtshams sbyar nas bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa'o //

translated: Having generated the thought of awakening in this way, the practitioner should practice everything in this sequence, always preceded by going for refuge to the nature of the Three Jewels.

translated: This is the knowledge called “Tārā, the Vanquisher of Death.” By always reciting it, one will find entry into the realm of the demigods.🔽Homage to the Three Jewels.🔽Homage to Amitābha,🔽the Tathāgata,🔽the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.🔽Homage to Noble Avalokiteśvara,🔽the Bodhisattva,🔽the Great Being.🔽O Amogha Tārā,🔽O Amogha Dharma Tārā, O Tārā whose Dharma is Amogha, O Tārā who brings about the accomplishment of Amogha, svāhā!🔽
